On 5 March 2018, a female rights defender was taken at a bus station in Beijing by the personnel in charge of stopping petitioners from the Beijing-based Office of the Shanghai Government to the Relief Administration Service Center of Beijing, and she was detained in a ''black jail'' inside the Hensha Island Beach Tianshi Resort after she was taken back to Shanghai by the local town government. During the Lianghui conventions, the Shanghai Government and the police department had a nationwide stability maintenance operation, and the rights defenders were their targets. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 5 March 2018, two female rights defender were taken from around Zhugangzi Village (Fangshan, Beijing) by the personnel in charge of stopping petitioners from the Beijing-based Office of the Shanghai Government. One of them was sent to a ''black jail'' in Shanghai while the other went incommunicado after she was taken back to Shanghai. During the Lianghui conventions, the Shanghai Government and the police department had a nationwide stability maintenance operation, and the rights defenders were their targets. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 5 March 2018, during the Lianghui conventions, a female petitioner was taken by unidentified people to Fuyou Street Police Station in Xicheng District (Beijing) when she was going to send a petition letter at Lixue Hutong in Xicheng District (Beijing), and she was sent to Jiujingzhuang ''black jail''. She was sent back to Shenyang the same night, then ''taken on mandatory holiday'' by stability maintenance personnel across various locations in Heilongjiang, Jilin and Liaoning from 6-13 March. She escaped on 14 Mar from the Dandong Fenghuang City Dongtang Town Wanze Hot Spring Holiday Hotel.

On 5 March 2018, a petitioner from Kangle Town, Chongqing was taken away by unidentified persons from Yindi Home Land in Fengtai District (Beijing) and sent to a black jail in Beijing Gaojiachang room 46-3.

On 5 March 2018, a female petitioner was taken away from the B Exit of Caofang Underground Station in Chaoyang District (Beijing) and sent to a black jail in Beijing Gaojiachang room 46-3 by officers from Chongqing Yubei District Police Department and the local Stability Maintenance Bureau.

On 5 March 2018, two female petitioners, who were sisters, were taken from Changzhou Wuxing Police Station in Zhonglou District (Changzhou, Jiangsu) to a black jail in a hotel in Changzhou by two male and two female unidentified people after the petitioners were summoned and interrogated at the police station. The two petitioners were intercepted in Beijing and taken back to Changzhou on 4 March 2018.

Around 5 March 2018 (between 2-9 March), a man was administered psychotropic drugs at the Heze No.3 People's Hospital in Mudan district (Heze, Shandong). He had been forcibly admitted and held incommunicado from 2 to 9 Mar by the CPC Secretary and Chief of Yangdian village, Dutang town of Dingtao county. It was reported that he appealed on behalf of his father three times that year, resulting in three coerced psychiatric ward admissions.

On 5 March 2018, a Kazakh man from Jiyeke (Zhiek) Village, Yumin County (Ili Kazak Autonomous, Xinjiang) was detained and sent to a re-education camp by the authorities, after he attempted to ask the authorities the day before to release his wife who had been detained. According to their son, his wife was sent to the re-education camp on 9 December 2017. He was released in December 2018 and had since returned to Kazakhstan, where he is a permanent resident.

On 5 March 2018, a Kazakh man who worked in the Qarasu village government office was taken away by the police from his place of residence in Tasarna Village, Qarasu Township (Ili Kazakh Autonomous, Xinjiang), and was believed to be sent to a re-education camp. He was then transferred to another camp on 10 October 2018. The reason for his detention is unclear, although all of the accusations suggested that it is likely to be related to his work at the religious affairs office.

On 6 March 2018, during the Lianghui conventions, a rights defender from Liaoning was stopped and attacked by the police when he was on his way to visit his parents. Several rights defenders have been attacked by the law enforcement personnel during the Lianghui conventions.

On 6 March 2018, two rights defenders were taken by local village officials and police officers in Shanghai and were handed over to a group of unidentified people by them, after that two rights defenders went incommunicado. During the Lianghui conventions, the Shanghai Government and the police department had a nationwide stability maintenance operation, and the rights defenders were their targets.

On 6 March 2018, a Shanghai human rights activist was beaten by 6 men from the Beijing-based Shanghai government while being held in a black prison set up by the Shanghai Municipal Government in Fengtai District (Beijing). She was beaten after refusing to go back to Shanghai with people she did not recognise but who claimed to be from the city's Jing'an District government. She was previously the victim of the forced demolition of her house and had not yet received compensation. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

Around 6 March 2018 (as reported), a petitioner from Wuhan City was taken in Beijing by unidentified people when he was petitioning in Beijing. He remained uncontactable at the time of reporting on 6 March 2018.

On 6 March 2018, a female petitioner went incommunicado after she was taken by the Beijing police in front of 101 Fuxingmennei Street and West Chang'an Avenue in Xicheng District (Beijing) when she and other petitioners were trying to intercept the cars of the Lianghui conventions delegates and petition. The petitioners intended to submit anti-corruption proposals and demanded to participate in the conventions.

On 6 March 2018, 3 family members of an activist being held in a black prison near to Lutun Town (Yingkou, Liaoning) went to visit the activist, but while at the detention site, they got into an argument with the ''stability maintenance special task forces'' guarding their family members and one of them was violently knocked to the floor by the guards.

On 7 March 2018, A female rights defender was taken from her home in Shanghai by a group of unidentified people and sent to a ''black jail'' inside Chongming Houniao Resort. During the Lianghui conventions, the Shanghai Government and the police department had a nationwide stability maintenance operation, and the rights defenders were their targets. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 7 March 2018, a Uyghur woman from Yingxiehai'er Village, Karakax County (Hotan Prefecture, Xinjiang) was sent to a re-education camp by the authorities. Additional government records also showed that she had started a 3-month ''housekeeping training'' course in December 2018 at the same facility. The likely reason for her detention was having more children than allowed in the family planning policy.

On 7 March 2018, a female petitioner was detained a 'black jail' in a four-storey building located in a valley of the 3303 military industrial district in Jiangxia district (Wuhan, Hubei), and disciplined after all her clothes were taken off. Her supervisors were allegedly government-hired farmers who spoke with a Honghu district accent, claiming to be sent by the 'Legal Education Base of the Six Central-Southern Provinces'. She was intercepted in Beijing and escorted back to her hometown under the orders of the Wuchan Petitioning Bureau. She was repeatedly tortured until her release on 17 Oct 2018.

On 8 March 2018, a female petitioner was arrested by two policemen from Fuyou street near the Zhongnanhai in Xicheng District (Beijing) when she was about to mail petition documents. She was then detained in the Beijing Jiujingzhuang Jieji Service Centre (a black jail) in Fengtai District (Beijing). At night, she was dragged out of the Service Centre by several unknown people (under the instructions of interceptors from her hometown of Zhangjiagang City) and put in a car. She reported that she was injured on her arms and body. On 9 March, she was sent back to her hometown in Jiangsu Province by train and would possibly be detained upon arrival. No further report on this event.

On 8 March 2018, A female rights defender was taken in Beijing and sent to Jiujingzhuang, a ''black jail'', by the Beijing police when she intended to petition to National People's Congress, and on the next day, she was sent to a ''black jail'' inside Chongming Houniao resort. During the Lianghui conventions, the Shanghai Government and the police department had a nationwide stability maintenance operation, and the rights defenders were their targets. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 8 March 2018, A female rights defender was taken in Beijing and sent to Jiujingzhuang, a ''black jail'', by the Beijing police when she intended to petition to National People's Congress, and later she was sent back to Shanghai by the government officials from Huangpu District. On the next day, she was sent to a ''black jail'' inside the Qingpu Jingui Island Fishing Resort. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 8 March 2018, a woman petitioner was arrested by police in Beijing and detained in the Beijing Jiujingzhuang Jieji Service Centre ''black prison''. Later the same day, she was taken back to a prison in her hometown in Zhangjiagang (Suzhou, Jiangsu). The petitioner is a victim of the illegal demolition of their home, for which she did not receive compensation, and travelled to Beijing to petition for her rights. During her detention in Beijing, the petitioner suffered injuries to her arms and body after being violently dragged out of the Jiujingzhuang black prison by several unidentified people.

On 9 March 2018, a female petitioner, when on her way back from Beijing where she petitioned for her husband about the Huangpu District Construct and Management Committee, as well as the sub-district office, violating laws and persecuting him, was ''secretly kidnapped'' by Shanghai liaison officers and hired thugs, then sent on a train and taken to a ''black jail'' in Shanghai Qingpu District Qingcheng area. [women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons]

On 9 March 2018, a female rights defender was intercepted by Shanghai liaison officers when she was about to petition at the National Public Complaints and Proposals Administration in Xicheng district (Beijing), and went incommunicado after they escorted her back to Shanghai. It was later revealed that she was sent to Qingpu Qingcheng ''black jail'' and guarded by ''special security personnel'' at least till 18 Mar. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 9 March 2018, a female rights defender were taken away from her home in Shanghai by nearly 20 people from the sub-district office and detained in a rural tourist resort in the suburbs of Shanghai. She had just been released from a detention centre where she was detained since 27 February 2018. She was previously held under soft detention in a rural tourist resort from 22 February but managed to escape on 26 February. She was taken into custody again by 20 to 30 police officers and personnel from the Public Complaints and Proposals Bureau when she was taking a train to Beijing on 27 February. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 9 March 2018, before the Tibetan Uprising Day, a Tibetan monk went incommunicado after the local authority took him from Wenbo Temple in Shiqu County (Garze, Sichuan). Before the Tibetan Uprising Day, Shiqu County was under surveillance and control of the local government, and the reason that he was taken was unknown.

Around 9 March 2018, a Uyghur woman from Xinyuan County (Ili Kazakh Autonomous, Xinjiang) was taken away by the authorities and sent to a re-education camp, where she was detained until her release on December 2018. She and her husband had returned to China on 13 November 2016 after living in Kazakhstan and had their passport confiscated. While her husband was able to get his passport four months later, she was left behind and later sent to a vocational school for around 20 days in April 2017. She was told by the authorities at the camp that she was detained for having lived in Kazakhstan for five years. She later gave an interview in June 2020, recounting that she received injections that made her period stop, and was also kicked in the stomach during interrogations.

On 9 March 2018, a female petitioner from Shanghai was taken away by the police and detained in a hotel in Beijing. On the next day, she was transferred to Shanghai, interrogated in the police office and detained in a ''black jail'' again for 10 days. It was part of a campaign by the local police to silence dissent during the annual meetings of Two Sessions.

On 9 March 2018, a human rights activist was abducted by a local public security officer in Beijing and has since been missing. The activist was able to send a message saying that the door of the rental house in which she was staying was being broken down before the phone was disconnected. In the past, the activist suffered the illegal demolition of their house and had gone to Beijing while the ''two sessions'' was being held to petition against illegal squatters on their land.

On 10 March 2018, a female petitioner went incommunicado and is suspected to have been kidnapped after she received an intravenous injection in a clinic in front of the Anhui Provincial Hospital in Luyang District (Hefei, Anhui). The petitioner went for the treatment because she suffered from a brain injury caused by the previous physical assault from the stability maintenance personnel. The petitioner was under residential surveillance by the sub-district office and attacked by stability maintenance officers previously due to her petitions in the past.

On 10 March 2018, a female petitioner was intercepted by a stability maintenance personnel of the Chongqing Liangjiang New Area Administration Committee and 6-7 unidentified people at a residential area in Beijing and detained at a black prison named Yuquanying Gaojiachang (Fengtai District, Beijing). The detention is related to the woman's repeated attempts to petition for monetary compensation for medical expenses on injuries caused to her while being violently abducted and beaten by unidentified people in Chongqing in 2017. Upon negotiation, she went back to Chongqing with the stability maintenance personnel on 11 March 2018 and checked into a hospital.

On 10 March 2018, a petitioner was taken by a group of unknown people to an unknown location from the Qianjiang Yangshi police office in Yangshi sub-district (Qianjiang, Hubei) and detained more than 50 days after being interrogated in the police station because he went to Beijing to petition. His head was covered by a sack, driven to the detention location, and tortured during the detention.

On 11 March 2018, four rights defenders were taken from their rented flat in Beijing by interceptors from the Shanghai liaison office. Two of them were escorted back to Shanghai and sent to a ''black jail'', while the remaining two defenders were taken to a Relief Service Centre ''black jail'' in Fengtai District (Beijing), forced returned to Shanghai afterwards, and went incommunicado when they were back in Shanghai. During the Lianghui conventions, the Chinese government had a nationwide stability maintenance operation, and the rights defenders were their targets.

On 11 March 2018, police raided a Christian house church in Urumqi, Xinjiang and sealed it off. The police confiscated over 100 books from the church and detained several leaders of the church. One of them was made to sit on the torture device known as the ''tiger bench'' during the interrogation.

Around 11 March 2018 (from 3 - 20 March), during the Lianghui conventions, a female petitioner was detained by the Beijing police when she was receiving medical treatment in Beijing and, after sending back to Shanghai, was kept in a ''black jail'' for ten days by the Minhang District Wujing Town Government. The petitioner has petitioned over property infringement by the Wujing Town Government and was previously kept in ''black jails''.

On 11 March 2018, a petitioner from Dongxiang Wuxi was sent to Jiujingzhuang ''black jail'' after the police from Beijing Fuyou Street Police Station inpected her ID in Beijing, and since 12 March 2018, she went incommunicado after she was sent back to Dongxiang by an unidentified vehicle and detained in the Dongxiang Police Station. During the Lianghui conventions, the Chinese government had a nationwide stability maintenance operation in which the rights defenders and petitioners were their targets.

On 11 March 2018, a female petitioner from Wujing town of Minhang district, Shanghai went incommunicado after she was taken back to Shanghai from Beijing, and was taken in for investigation at the police station. The police denied detaining her, and said village authorities took her away, although they also denied the same. During the Lianghui conventions, the Chinese government had a nationwide stability maintenance operation in which the rights defenders and petitioners were their targets.

On 11 March 2018, during the Lianghui conventions, a petitioner's daughter living in Weicheng District (Xianyang, Shaanxi) was sent to take on mandatory vacation by the officials from the Weicheng Sub-district Office. The petitioner had petitioned over the years because his son was attacked by a colleague when he was working for the Thermal Power Company the Third Bureau, but the company refused to compensate, and the perpetrator was not charged. [women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons]

On 11 March 2018, a female human rights activist from Shanghai was picked up by Beijing police from Fuyou street near the Zhongnanhai in Xicheng District (Beijing). She was then detained in two separate ''black jails'' until 12 March before being transferred to the underground criminal detention centre in Huayang police station in Changning District, Shanghai, where she was held incommunicado until her release on 12 April 2018. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 11 March 2018, during the Lianghui conventions, a female rights defender were taken by the local stability maintenance officer when she was attending her cousin's wedding in Sichuan and kept in Xingyuan Hotel, while on 15 March 2018, she was taken to Nanchong Huicheng Mental Hospital and forced to be admitted, but she managed to avoid it. The rights defender was charged ''inciting subversion'' because she posted on Twitter. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 11 March 2018, a female human rights activist was transferred out of Yangzhou City Detention Centre (Jiangsu) and placed under ''residential surveillance at a designated location'' based on the charge of ''inciting subversion of state power.'' She was initially arrested on 9 February 2018 while she was visiting her hometown in Yangzhou, and would be released on bail on 2 September 2018. Her arrest was reportedly part of the CPC's crackdown on an influential internet group, the ''Rose group'', that was used to advocate for human rights. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 11 March 2018, a human rights defender was taken away by state security forces and held incommunicado in a ''black jail'' for 10 days as part of the security crackdown during the annual meetings of the National People's Congress (NPC) and the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference (CPPC). She resisted authorities' attempts to admit her to a mental hospital in Nanchong City (Sichuan) during these 10 days. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 12 March 2018, a petitioner who petitioned against foced eviction and the under-valuation of her property was taken into a van by a group of unidentified kidnappers who broke into her temporary residence in Beijing (Beijing) and detained at the Beijing Reception Management and Service Center in Fengtai district Youwai Dongzhuang 90.

On 12 March 2018, several petitioners from Wuhan were taken in Beijing to Jiujingzhuang ''black jail'' by the police officers patrolling in streets in Beijing when they went to petition at the National Public Complaints and Proposals Administration and the hotels where the representatives of the National People's Congress were staying.

On 12 March 2018, a female rights defender who was a former victim of Liaoning Masanjia Female Labour Camp was taken by the local interceptors from Beijing Tianqiao in Xicheng District (Beijing) to the Xidan Street Police Station, handed over to the local government by the Beijing police, forced to return to Benxi Liaoning, and went incommunicado later. During the Lianghui conventions, the Chinese government had a nationwide stability maintenance operation, and the rights defenders were their targets. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 12 March 2018, a female rights defender from Banan Chongqing was taken by people from the Beijing-based office of the Chongqing Government while she was in Beijing to petition and sent back to Chongqing by the local government. After that, she was sent to the Yudong Yunzhuan Mountain Qingfeng Gorge Hotel in Banan District, Chongqing, got her ID confiscated by the local police, and went incommunicado. During the Lianghui conventions, the Chinese government had a nationwide stability maintenance operation, and the rights defenders were their targets. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 13 March 2018, a female rights defender was sent back to Shanghai from Beijing, kept in Room 912 in Shanghai Chongming District Changxin Island Hotel, and the room was guarded, as well as her phone and public transport card were confiscated by six men and two women. The petitioner went on a hunger strike when she was kept in the hotel, and she was later sent to Shanghai Yangpu District Jungong Road No. 2180 Gongqing Forest Holiday Resort where she started a hunger strike again. She was released on 27 March 2018.

On 13 March 2018, a petitioner was sent back to Shanghai from Beijing by a government interceptor and handed over to 4 unknown individuals at an underground parking lot in Shanghai Hongqiao Railway Station (Minhang District, Shanghai). The 4 unknown individuals took him to a ''black jail'', presumably in Shanghai, where he was beaten upon arrival and detained for 12 days. He was dropped on a road in Pudong New Area (Shanghai) on 24 March 2018.

On 13 March 2018, during the Lianghui conventions, a rights defender were forced to take ''mandatory vacation'' in Hainan Island by three police after he was taken from Suixi County (Zhanjiang, Guangdong) and got his phone, as well as ID, confiscated. During the Lianghui conventions, the Chinese government had a nationwide stability maintenance operation, and the rights defenders were their targets.

On 13 March 2018, a petitioner who had been detained in a black jail in Fengtai District, Beijing the previous day was transferred to a black jail in Shanghai by a staff of the Shanghai Pudong District Kangqiao Town government and some gangsters. Her food was poisoned during her detention there until 27 March 2018.

On 14 March 2018, a rights defender and her brother were physically abused in Dengzhou (Nanyang, Henan) by the police when they were kept in the hotel after the police took them from their friends' home which they were visiting. Later they were sent to the Nanyang Guangwu Police Station and went incommunicado.

On 14 March 2018, a political activist had to be hospitalized during his detention in Nanjing after being locked in a washroom and beaten up by the police. A few days later, he was allowed early release, but beaten again at the police station after he requested that the police filed a notice stating his release followed proper legal procedure.

Around 15 March 2018 (between 9-21 March 2018), a human rights activist was violently slapped by local ruffians hired by the local government during his detention in the ''black jail'' in Qingpu District (Shanghai). He was forcibly intercepted by officials from the Shanghai Municipal Office when he was filing a complaint at the State Bureau for Letters and Calls in Xicheng District (Beijing) on 9 March 2018. He was then forcibly repatriated to Shanghai where he was illegally detained in a ''black jail'' until his release on 21 March 2018.

On 15 March 2018, liaison officers kidnapped and assaulted a female petitioner from Yangjian town, Wuxi while she was in Beijing mailing reporting materials to high-level government officials. Her clothes were torn and damaged amidst physical altercations. They drove her back to the police station in Yangjian, and when they arrived, the police refused to file her assault case and pretended not to hear or acknowledge her.

On 15 March 2018, a female petitioner from Shanghai was taken away in Gaoqiao Town (Pudong, Shanghai) by four to five people from the Public Complaints and Proposals Administration. She was detained overnight at Gaoqiao Police Station before being held at Chongming Island (a ''black jail'') until 20 March 2018. She was then transferred to a hotel opposite Gaoqiao Police Station where her husband, son, and daughter were also detained. The petitioner and her daughter were released on 23 March 2018. On 21 March 2018, the local government also demolished her residence. [women targeted: girls]

On 15 March 2018, four rights defenders, including two women, were intercepted by the Shanghai government personnel at the Shanghai Railway Station in Jing'an District (Shanghai). One of them was then handed over to some unidentified security guards hired by the Gaoqiao Town Government and taken to Changxin Island Guangrong Village ''black jail''. Another rights defender was detained in Changxin Island Guangrong Village ''black jail''. Both were detained until the end of the Lianghui annual sessions. The whereabouts of the two other female rights defenders were not reported.

On 15 March 2018, two Kazakh brothers were taken away by the authorities from Emin County (Tacheng, Xinjiang) and detained in a re-education camp. Their detention were likely related to their father writing a complaint to the authorities in Beijing regarding the death of another Kazakh man, who was beaten to death while detained at a re-education camp. Their father was also detained on the same day, shortly after the brothers were taken away, and their mother was detained soon after lodging a complaint at the local district authorities. The two brothers and their mother were released at the end of 2018, while the father was sentenced to 20 years in prison in October 2018. Following a call with a family member on 27 January 2019, the brothers and mother were reportedly detained again, but held under some sort of 'soft detention'. On 5 December 2020 or 14 December 2020, it was reported that the father died while still in prison, though some sources believe that he was dead long before this date. The body has not been returned to the family.

On 16 March 2018, a female rights defender went incommunicado in Shanghai after she went to petition at the liaison office of the National People's Congress in Beijing (location not known) but was stopped by the police, sent to Yangfangdian Police Station in Haidian district, and escorted back to Shanghai via train G133 that same day. During the Lianghui conventions, the Chinese government had a nationwide stability maintenance operation, and the rights defenders were their targets. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 16 March 2018, a female rights defender was sent to a ''black jail'' in the Relief Administration Service Center of Beijing by the plainclothes police officers following her when she was petitioning at the Beijing Municipal Public Security Bureau in Dongcheng District (Beijing) about the inaction of the Shanghai Police Department, and later the interceptors from Changshou Sub-district sent her back to Shanghai and to the ''back jail'' in No. 678 Anyuan Road. During the Lianghui conventions, the Chinese government had a nationwide stability maintenance operation, and the rights defenders were their targets. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

Around 16 March 2018 (month of), security guards hired by local authorities used electric batons on a farmer's wife and her sister in Lingchuan Town (Putian, Fujian) and the women were knocked unconscious. The farmer had died in custody a few days ago and the women had gone to the police station and town secretary to bring the farmer's body back for a memorial service. [women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons]

Around 16 March 2018 (month of), five police officers took away a female Christian believer in Shihezi City, Xinjiang for her belief. They tortured her at a local police station by putting her into a small iron cage used for animals, with her legs and hands chained to the bars of the cage. She was locked up for 24 hours in the cage before being released.
Around 16 March 2018 (month of), 16 Muslim Han Chinese believers were arrested during worship in Shihezi. As of 15 Aug, their whereabouts have remained unknown for five months.

Around 16 March 2018 (month of), in Dongmaili village (Gongliu county, Ili, Xinjiang), a Kazakh woman was taken away and sent to a re-education camp. It was later claimed that she was sentenced to 12 years in prison sometime in 2019.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Government of China (2012-); Kazakh Ethnic Group (China)
NOTES: Around 16 March 2018 (month of), a Kazakh Chinese politician -- member of the National Committee of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference, and of the National People's Congress Representative of Ili Kazakh Autonomous Prefecture -- was arrested by masked government special agents from his home in Nalati (Narat) town of Xinyuan county (Xinjiang). He went incommunicado, and whereabouts and situation remained unknown as of 21 March 2019. Three public security and law enforcement bodies gave no response despite calls from his family in Kazakhstan.

Around 16 March 2018 (month of), two police officers and over a dozen thugs kidnapped a farmer who was fighting for his rights over his forcibly seized land in Lingchuan Town (Putian, Fujian) ordered by local officials. Days later, the family learned that the farmer had died while in detention. While the police officer claimed that he committed suicide, another government insider later stated that the farmer was beaten to death by his abductees, as his body was filled with blood and bruises. His family members were assaulted a few days later when they asked to bring his body back for a memorial service.

Around 16 March 2018 (month of), a Uyghur Muslim family (the father, his two sons and two daughters) was arrested in Huocheng (Ili, Xinjiang) and forcibly sent to a transformation through education camp. They continued to be held at the camp at the time of reporting on 9 October 2018.

Around 16 March 2018 (month of), local police forcibly took away three Muslim brothers from Huocheng County (Ili Kazak Autonomous, Xinjiang) and put them into a ''transformation through education'' camp, for using a file-sharing mobile app.

Around 16 March 2018 (month of), two ethnic Kazakh sisters (a newspaper employee and a hair salon owner) disappeared from Xinjiang province [coded to Shuimogou district]. In June of the same year, their family was notified of their extrajudicial incarcerations with sentences of 15 and 19 years respectively, both for crimes still unknown.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Hui Ethnic Group (China); Muslim Group (China); Uyghur Ethnic Group (China)
NOTES: Around 16 March 2018 (month of), more than 26 Hui Muslims and one Uyghur Muslim were arrested from the villages of Shawan county (Tarbagatay, Xinjiang). As of August 2018, the whereabouts of six of them were still unknown.

Around 16 March 2018 (month of), five Kazakhs were taken from Zhaosu County (Ili, Xinjiang) and sent to re-education camps. They were four brothers and the wife of one of the brothers, and two of the brothers working as teachers in the first secondary school in 76th Production and Construction Corps, while the other two working in 10th Company of 76th Corp.

Around 16 March 2018 (month of), a group of masked persons kidnapped an ethnic Kazakh Imam from his home in Nalatizhen Town in Xinyuan County (Ili, Xinjiang). He was once a representative of the Xinjiang Ili Prefecture and a member of the Xinjiang CPPCC and has been incommunicado since December 2018.

Around 16 March 2018 (month of), 30 Tibetans in Xiaqu Town (Nagqu, Tibet) were arrested and beaten by the authorities for opposing a mining project in their region and for suspicion of ''leaking information'' about the local opposition shortly after it was reported by media outside Tibet in early March 2018. The village leader was arrested by authority in February 2018 and his whereabouts remained unknown. Authorities had increased control over Xiaqu Town, blocking locals' communication channels such as WeChat and internet and telephone signal.

Around 16 March 2018 (month of), a female petitioner was beaten by government employed ruffians while she was detained in a hotel room in Fuping county (Weinan, Shaanxi). The petitioner were taken on 28 February 2018 when she and her husband were called to the town government office to discuss their case. 4-5 government employed ruffians kidnapped them to a hotel, and shortly after that they took her to another hotel in Fuping county and detained her there until 31 March 2018 when she was sent back home. It was reported that the female petitioner was beaten several times, and once she fainted after one of the ruffians pushed her to the floor and stepped on her head. It was also reported that, during her detention, she had a blood sample taken and felt numbness in her hands after eating some meals brought by the guards.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Kazakh Ethnic Group (China); Police Forces of China (2012-)
NOTES: Around 16 March 2018 (month of), a Kazakh policeman and Kazakhstan green card holder living in Oyman Bulaq village, Qaragash township of Ghulja (Yining) county (Ili, Xinjiang) was detained and sent to an ''internment camp'' for 18 months before being sentenced in Oct 2019 to 10 years of prison (in Wusu Prison) and forced labour, and five years of deprivation of political rights. He was arrested for inciting ethnic hatred via posting on Weibo. Official accounts said he was sentenced on 11 Apr 2018 without ever having been in a political re-education centre.

On 16 March 2018, a rights defender went incommunicado after the Beijing police inspected his ID when he was changing underground at Beijing Hepingmen Underground Station, and sent him to the Fuyoujie Police Station in Xicheng District (Beijing). During the Lianghui conventions, the Chinese government had a nationwide stability maintenance operation, and the rights defenders were their targets.

On 16 March 2018, a rights defender was taken to Jiujingzhuang ''black jail'' by the Beijing police when he was begging around Tiananmen Square in Dongcheng District (Beijing), sent to Relief Administration Service Center of Beijing by the personnel from the Beijing-based Office of the Shanghai Government, and went incommunicado after he was sent back to Shanghai on 17 March 2018. During the Lianghui conventions, the Chinese government had a nationwide stability maintenance operation, and the rights defenders were their targets.

Around 16 March 2018 (as reported), a Kazakh gynaecologist from Zhaosu county (Ili, Xinjiang) was taken away by the police and detained incommunicado. It was reported that she was sentenced to 18 years in prison in February 2019. The reason for her detention is suspected to be related to her religious affiliations, as she had been previously married to an Imam imprisoned in 2017.

Around 16 March 2018 (month of), a female petitioner-cum-forced evictee from Dongxihu district, Wuhan was kidnapped by government-hired triad members while working in Tangshan prefecture (Hebei) (coded to Lubei), then taken back to a 'black jail' in Dongxihu district. She was severely beaten during her kidnapping, which lasted for 130 days.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Government of China (2012-); Police Forces of China (2012-)
NOTES: Around 17 March 2018 (from 9 - 25 March), a female petitioner was covered with a duvet, pushed around, physically abused by a group of men in the Jianxin Police Department in Cangshan District (Fuzhou, Fujian), and later she was abused by these men again in the Fuzhou Detention Center No.406 detention room. The female petitioner was taken to the Jianxin Police Department by a group of plain-clothes police officers on 9 March 2018 because she previously petitioned over the forced eviction.

On 18 March 2018, the head of Village Committee in Jingshan Village (Ji'an, Jiangxi) stabbed the Village Party Secretary and his father to death in the local village committee election because he believes that the election was manipulated, and two people died.

Around 18 March 2018, a citizen was taken by the police from Xiamen (Fujian) and sent back to his hometown in Zixi (Fuzhou, Jiangxi) where he had since been held incommunicado. His family was not told about the reason of this arrest and was not allowed to contact him by the time of report on 1 April 2018. He had previously organised some street protests in 2013 and was detained for eight months by the police. It was also reported that he was detained for ten days in 2016 because he tried to be elected to become a local people's representative.

On 18 March 2018, a Shanghai rights defender went incommunicado after he was taken by a group of unidentified people at the Wuxi Railway Station in Liangxi District (Wuxi, Jiangsu). During the Lianghui conventions, the Chinese government had a nationwide stability maintenance operation, and the rights defenders were their targets.

On 18 March 2018, a female rights defender was physically assaulted and injured by the government-appointed thugs at the Jinghua Hotel in Fengtai District (Beijing) where the Beijing-based Office of the Wuxi Government was. She was taken to the hotel by a group of unidentified people at the Fuyou Street Post Office when she finished sending her petition letter. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 19 March 2018, during the Lianghui conventions, a female petitioner-cum-forced evictee from Qiaokou DIstrict (Wuhan, Hubei) was sent to a ''black jail'' in Wuhan City (Hubei), and the ''black jail'' was guarded by 7-8 people hired by the Secretary of the Qiaokou District Liujiao Stree Sub-district. They confiscated her ID and was not given food for at least five days. It was reported that as a result of the lack of food, her vision became blurry and she started feeling the effects of high blood pressure and heart disease, and her head and eyes also hurt, but she had no medication.

Around 19 March 2018 (between 14 - 24 March), a dissident from Nanjing was physically abused and injured by the officers in the bathroom of the Nanjing Detention Centre in Pukou District (Nanjing, Jiangsu) after he repeatedly chanted ''overthrow Soviet Mao Communist Party''. The dissident was was taken to the detention centre on 14 March because he posted anti-CCP and mocking-constitution-amendment posts online during the Lianghui Conventions. He was originally supposed to be detained for 14 days, but was released early and sent to the hospital after being beaten up because the police were afraid he would die in custody.

On 19 March 2018, a couple from Shanghai Zhabei District, who were petitioning about force eviction at Public Complaints and Proposals Reception of the Beijing Municipal Public Security Bureau in Dongcheng District (Beijing), went incommunicado after they were intercepted and taken by a group of unidentified people. When they were standing in line at the reception and waiting to petition, the interceptors were trying to take the husband and failed, but a group of unidentified people intercepted them in a Hutong around the reception when the couple went to buy lunch.

On 21 March 2018, a human rights activist was beaten by 6-7 government hired thugs (which the government called ''temporary workers'') at a commune petition office in Hongkou District (Shanghai). He went to the commune petition office earlier on the day to report his recent abduction by government employed personnel but was not accepted by the staff there. After being beaten, he also called the police to the scene, but the police refused to intervene.

On 23 March 2018, a Kazakh man from Tuosite Township, Jeminay County (Ili Kazakh Autonomous, Xinjiang) was detained by the authorities and sent to a re-education camp. Prior to this, he had been detained by village cadres at a detention centre or prison for 15 days starting from 30 January 2018 for having Skype installed on his mobile phone. It was believed that he was sent to the camp for the same reason. He was later 'sentenced' while still in camp for breaking the telecommunications law. He was released on 24 December 2018, and returned to Kazakhstan on 29 November 2019.

On 24 March 2018, a dissident was physically abused and injured when he went to the Zhujiang Police Station in Pukou District (Nanjing, Jiangsu) and asked for his release notice. Previously, He has been physically abused and injured during his detention in the Nanjing Detention Centre.

On 25 March 2018, a woman was taken from Fuhai county (Burultokay county, Altay prefecture, Xinjiang), and later discovered in May to have been sent to a ''political re-education camp.'' After her release around 20 December 2018, she was not able to reunite with her married family in Kazakhstan after issues with obtaining the necessary travel documents.

On 25 March 2018, a petitioner, together with another petitioner from Nantong, was taken from their rental house in Yancun Town Dadong Village (Fangshan, Beijing) by more than ten police and sent to Jiujingzhuang ''black jail'', together with around eight other petitioners in the police car. He was later picked up by four people from the Beijing-based Office of the Dandong Government, send to Dandong Qidao Police Station and a small hotel in Jinshan Town, and kept in the hotel, but when he was released and went back to Beijing, he was detained again in the Beijing Railway Station police station, sent by the personnel from the Beijing-Based Office of the Dandong Government to Longhugong Hotel where their Office is, and kept there for three hours before his release.

On 26 March 2018, a petitioner was captured by ''unemployed triad members'' right after she was released from police custody. Police officers had barged into her home in Beijing on 14 March 2018 and transported her to a detention center in Wuhan City (where she was originally from), where she was illegally detained for 10 days. The triad members detained her for 3 months before transferring her to a ''citizens' learning centre black jail'' in Dongxihu District, Wuhan on 1 July. On 2 August 2018, she was transferred to a police station before being released.

On 27 March 2018, a rights defender was slapped by a national security officer on their way to the police station in Changyuan County (Xinxiang, Henan), physically abused, and ordered to kneel by the national security officers when he was in Changyuan County Police Department. The rights defender was summoned by the Changyuan County Police Department to interrogation over the participation in two rights-defender groups.

On 27 March 2018, a Tibetan monk of Labrang monastery in Gansu's Sangchu (in Chinese, Xiahe) county, disappeared after receiving a call from the Chinese state security officers. He was released on 5 April 2018 ''without explanation'' after being detained ''in secret'' by the police for questioning. There were no signs that he had suffered any torture or been beaten. It was also reported that he had been previously held for questioning for a few days around 10 March 2018, the anniversary of a failed 1959 national uprising against Chinese rule in Tibet.

On 27 March 2018, eight Mongolian petitioners from Bayan Nur City Urad Middle Banner and Dengkou County were taken by the police around Zhongnanhai in Xicheng District (Beijing) and sent to Majialou ''black jail'' when they were on their way to submit petition documents to National Public Complaints and Proposals Administration. They were later taken back by the Bayan Nur City police and detained.

On 28 March 2018, around 5 unknown individuals (likely to be hired by government officials) beat up a couple near a restaurant in Xiangcheng District (Suzhou, Jiangsu) who were petitioners since 2010 because of their demolished house. Two men pulled the woman's hair and beat her. Her husband was also beaten by other 3-4 men wearing face masks. Their friends called the police, but there was no further update from the police. The couple had been harassed by government employed personnel in the past.

On 29 March 2018, the underground Archbishop of Roman Catholic Diocese of Funing, possibly together with the Diocesan Secretary, were ''forcibly traveled'' from Ningde (Fujian) to Xiamen and were only allowed to return on 31 March 2018. It was also reported that the Archbishop and his secretary were summoned by the State Administration for Religious Affairs on 26 March 2018 and detained for around 24 hours.

Around 30 March 2018, a retired judge from Xinjiang was transferred by the police from the Detention Centre of Tumxuk (Xinjiang) to the Centre of Legal Education and placed under ''Residential Surveillance at a Designated Location'' after the court revoked the charge. The retired judge was arrested because he assisted the defence of the rights of employees in the Third Agricultural Division Farm.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Government of China (2012-); Police Forces of China (2012-)
SOURCE: Radio Free Asia; Epoch Times; China Aid
NOTES: On 30 March 2018, a parent was beaten up by security guards, who are suspected to be sent by the government, outside the Bafu Christian Public Kindergarten Beiqijia Town (Changping, Beijing) and had to be hospitalized after losing the ability to move by himself. The security guards, about 40 of them, had arrived at the kindergarten the day before, kicked out all the teachers and students, locked up the school from the inside, and started removing furniture. Dozens of teachers and parents soon gathered to oppose their actions, and the man was beaten up then. Police also arrived to the scene and took away some of the people gathered outside for interrogation. Previously, on 25 March, the school was also raided by many security guards who threw out the school's belongings from the building, and teachers and parents had to come together to move the items back into the school.

On 30 March 2018, a female petitioner, together with other petitioners, was taken by the police at the entrance of Xihongmen Underground Station in Daxing District (Beijing), after inspecting her ID and found out that she was a monitored subject, and sent her to Jiujingzhuang ''black jail''. She was later picked up by the personnel from the Beijing Office of the Shanghai Government and sent back to Shanghai on 31 March 2018.

Around 31 March 2018 (end of month), an old imam and his son living in Ulan-Usu town of Shawan county (Tarbagatay prefecture, Xinjiang) were sent to a ''transformation through education'' camp after police officers charged into their home, and lured them to the police station under false pretexts. The imam became progressively sick due to unhygienic and filthy living conditions; he was sent to the hospital for treatment, then brought back to the camp after recovery.

Around 31 March 2018 (end of month), police and village cadres conducted a house raid and arrested a house church leader, his son and two Christians in Manas county of Changji Hui Autonomous Prefecture, Xinjiang. They were then held at a ''transformation through education'' camp in Lanzhouwan town of Manas. During the raid, they confiscated several Bible copies, 130,000 USD in cash, and took control of two single-story houses owned by the house church leader.

Around 31 March 2018 (end of month), a Tibetan merchant from Nagqu was arrested at the Lhasa Kongga (Gonggar) International Airport in Shannan city, Tibet after a domestic flight from Chengdu. He was found traveling with articles about politics and possessing photos of the Dalai Lama at home. He has been incommunicado for five months since and his whereabouts are unknown.

On 31 March 2018, an Uyghur woman from Urumqi, Xinjiang was called by the local neighbourhood administration and then taken to a local police station for interrogation. She was fixed to the tiger chair during the interrogation about her marriage to a Pakistani and her bank transfers to Pakistan. She was then taken to a re-education camp where she was detained for around 2 months until her release on 2 June 2018. Before she left China, she was reportedly forced to pay a RMB 18,000 fine for her third child being born ''outside the plan'', and was forced to undergo sterilization on 22 October 2018 in order to be given permission to leave the country. Her family left for Pakistan in January 2019 and later went to the US in April 2019 to apply for asylum.

On 1 April 2018, an arrested member of The Church of Almighty God died while in detention in Qingzhen city, Guizhou. While officials claimed she committed suicide by locking and hanging herself in a shower, family members doubted it. Police also denied them the chance to see her body because no staff was on duty at the funeral home, and said they would be implicated in her Christian belief if they asked further questions.

On 1 April 2018, a Uyghur Muslim man in hiding was shot dead on a culvert in Liangfanchang at Huocheng county of Ili prefecture, after a 70,000-persons police manhunt following his escape from internment at a ''transformation through education'' camp. He had made multiple attempts to resist arrest since May 2017, when he was first arrested for ''participating in unlawful religious activities.''

On 1 April 2018, a female petitioner was taken by government stability maintenance personnel in Chongqing because she was planning to go to petition in Beijing. She managed to call others before being taken, then she became missing until the time of reporting on 2 April 2018.

On 2 April 2018, hundreds of police and government employed personnel beat up villagers at Shuitian Village (Yanjin county, Zhaotong, Yunan) with electric batons to forcibly take over their farmland to build a road. It was suspected that some of the people wearing police uniforms were local triad members employed by the government. Several villagers were injured, including children. Ten villagers were also arrested by police.

On 2 April 2018, a military veteran was assaulted in Lingyan Mountain in Wuzhong District (Suzhou City, Jiangsu Province) by six to seven local ruffians who were reportedly hired by government officials. The assailants hit the top of his head with a tree branch, and kicked him in the waist. A passer-by attempted to file a police report but was told by the police that the assailants were sent by the local government for ''stability maintenance''. One of his ribs was fractured. It was reported that the military veteran had been placed under surveillance at his own residence by ''thugs'' hired by government officials to stop him from petitioning after he was sentenced to six months in prison in 2001.

On 2 April 2018, two women were shot by unknown individuals using an air gun in Iao Hon Market Garden in Macao in the morning, when they were singing China's communist revolution themed ''red songs'' in the park together with a group of mostly middle-aged and elderly women. It was also reported that another similar incident took place at the same spot about 10 days ago leaving one person injured. No deaths reported.

On 3 April 2018, hundreds of security personnel employed by the village committee chairman in Qinbei Village (Gangzha District, Nantong, Jiangsu) blocked an elderly couple in their house and destroyed their farmland aiming to take over the land for building a road. When the couple tried to stop them, they got slapped repeatedly on their faces. They reported to the police, but the police took them to the police station and accused the man for biting the hand of a security guard.

On 3 April 2018, two petitioners and their child were beaten by two people employed by neighbourhood committee that was in charge of housing and demolition in Changlou Village, Xiangcheng District (Suzhou, Jiangsu). The man was beaten in his head and the child was injured in his leg. The couple had been petitioning to get proper housing relocation since 2010.

On 3 April 2018, a Uighur Muslim man seeking political asylum in Germany was deported to Beijing. Thereafter, he went missing and was not able to be contacted. An administrative miscommunication between the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees and local authorities in Bavaria led to his deportation. His immigration lawyer in Germany had not heard from him since the flight and suspects that he has been detained by Chinese authorities.

On 4 April 2018, an 82-year-old man was taken by 4 police officers from his home to the nearby police office in Tiedong District (Siping, Jilin) because he was planning to go to Beijing for petition. He was forced to sit on a ''tiger bench'' during interrogation and was kept in the police office for 8 hours and were not given food or water. The police let him go home at around midnight.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Kazakh Ethnic Group (China); Former Government of China (2012-)
NOTES: On 5 April 2018, a Kazakh man (who was working as the governor of Toli County in the last 1-2 years) was taken away by the authorities likely from Toli County (Ili Kazak Autonomous, Xinjiang) and sent to a re-education camp, according to a testimony from his sister. It was reported he was likely detained for bribery and signing a contract to build a mosque, while the official investigation notice stated that he was being investigated for serious breach of the law and CCP's discipline. He was then reportedly sentenced to 4 years in prison and is currently detained in a prison, though it was unclear when he was transferred to the prison.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Tibetan Ethnic Group (China); Women (China); Buddhist Group (China)
NOTES: Around 5 April 2018 (week of), a Tibetan woman was taken away by plain clothes officers from the Domestic Security Bureau while she was passing through Darlag County (Golog, Qinghai) and disappeared thereafter. She was en route to Lhasa from her home in Bola Village, Xiahe, Gansu for a pilgrimage. Her friends and family who were on pilgrimage with her were warned against telling others about her detention. The reason of her arrest was reportedly due to her visits to another Tibetan monk who were detained for protesting activities.

On 5 April 2018, a dozen villagers in Fushan Village (Shantou, Guangdong) got into a dispute with a party leader and his son on the street because the village party leader sold farmland without permission of the farmers. The Party leader's son then drove a car and ran over a villager and escaped the scene while the others threw stones to the car. The villager died, while other one was reportedly injured.

Around 5 April 2018, a Kazakh female school teacher was taken away by the authorities likely from Altay City (Ili Kazakh Autonomous, Xinjiang), shortly before she had fully recovered from her operation. She reportedly spent five months in a re-education camp, before she was released on 30 August 2018. Before her detention, she was working in China during the school year and living in Kazakhstan during the summer and winter breaks.

On 8 April 2018, a man was tortured by being forced to squat outside for an entire night when the temperature was 3 degree Celcius by police in Shijingshan District, Beijing after being taken to Beijing Public Security Bureau Shijingshan Branch by Police and national security personnel. The reason for being taken by the police is related to the man's wife, who was participating in a march organized by missing human rights lawyer Wang Quanzhang's wife. Police had asked the man to bring his wife home and retaliated when he refused to cooperate.

On 8 April 2018, a Hui poet was taken by two plain-clothes police when he got off the flight in the Jinggangshan Airport in Luoxi town (Ji'an, Jiangxi). The police refused to give reason for locking him up, but and the poet believed that it was due to his published works about Xinjiang Uyghurs.

On 9 April 2018, a Shanghai female human rights activist was taken by police from Fuyou Street in Xicheng District (Beijing), sent to a ''black jail'' in Fengtai District (Beijing) set up by the Shanghai Municipal Government and lost contact thereafter. She was in Beijing to petition for her forcibly demolished house. She had been harassed and detained several times by authorities in the past. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 9 April 2018, a Muslim man living in Shawan county, Xinjiang (Tarbagatay prefecture) was sent to a ''transformation through education'' camp after officers showed up at his house, and lured him to the police station under false pretexts. His brother was also sent to the same camp by the police two days later.

On 9 April 2018, a villager and his brother were beaten by a village chief and almost 100 public security personnel at their home in Xinmin Community (Shuangliu, Chengdu) while they were there to demolish their house. They were pushed to the ground and attacked on their heads. The villager was later dragged into a car by police and detained for five hours.

On 9 April 2018, a Uyghur businessman from Saybag district (Urumqi, Xinjiang) was summoned by the police and then sent to a re-education camp. The reasons for his detention remain unclear, though it is suspected to be related to his frequent trips abroad to Muslim-majority countries, or the fact that his entire family is living abroad.

On 10 April 2018, a Uyghur woman from Moyu municipality (Hotan, Xinjiang) and sent to the Qaraqash No. 4 re-education camp. Her current status is unknown and no official reason has been given for her arrest, but the reasons stated on her record discovered in a leaked government file were: being a person of 'average trustworthiness' with 12 years of prison time served and being a person under suspicion. It is reported that she was approved for release in early 2019, but is currently still in camp.

On 10 April 2018, a woman that was participating in the march to search for the last missing ''709 lawyer'' was taken by police from Tianjin and sent to Xushui District (Baoding, Hebei) for a ''mandatory vacation''. Her husband was taken on the same day by police and sent to the same place to be restricted together with her. They were not told how long they would be restricted at the ''vacation place''.

On 11 April 2018, two women were beaten up by dozens of people including security police and street and community personnel in Shijingshan District (Beijing) when they tried to visit the wife of a ''709'' lawyer (the lawyer had been missing for around 1,000 days). The group of government personnel had been gathering at the residence of the human rights lawyer to prevent anyone from entering or exiting the house. They kicked the victims and attacked them with a chair. The two victims were sent to hospital later. Some journalist on the scene was also dragged out of a car and beaten by the police.

On 11 April 2018, a Muslim man living in Shawan county, Xinjiang (Tarbagatay prefecture) was sent to a ''transformation through education'' camp after police called him to the police station. He suspects that he was caught because his phone had been monitored, and not long ago, a message he sent expressing ''his faith in God'' alerted the police. Two days ago, the police also sent his brother to the same camp.

On 11 April 2018, it was reported that former students from 14 villages in Chengduo County (also known as Chindu County) in Yushu (Qinghai Province) who have become monks and nuns, were forced to receive military training. Compulsorily recruited local students were warned from refusing participation and threaten that their family members will not be allowed to dig cordyceps and will be subject to economic punishment.

Around 11 April 2018 (between 11 - 12 April), over 10 triad group members hired by a village Party Secretary forcibly dragged a sick petitioner from his ward at Liangxiang Hospital in Fangshan District, Beijing, two times and threw him outside. The attacks worsened his sickness and caused him to have a mental breakdown.

On 11 April 2018, a rights defender in Sichuan was taken by security police to be detained in a hotel room after leaving her relative's wedding because of the annual meetings of ''lianghui''. She was released on 20 April 2018 after ''lianghui'' was over. The defender was verbally abused and humiliated during detainment. Also, she was taken to a psychiatric hospital in Nanchong (Sichuan) on 15 April 2018, and had to resist very hard to avoid being injected. After being released, she continued being monitored by security police. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

Around 14 April 2018 (from 10 to 18 April), a female member of The Church of Almighty God was arrested by 3 police officers and tortured in Nianzhuang Town (Xuzhou City, Jiangsu Province). She was taken to the Nianzhuang police station on 10 April and then transferred to Pizhou Ruixing Hotel, where she was photographed and interrogated. As she refused to answer questions, she was forced onto a tiger bench and subjected to torture in many ways. She was tortured almost every day until she found a chance to escape from the hotel on 18 April. Her arms were injured badly.

Around 15 April 2018 (month of), the parents of a Hui villager were taken away by the authorities in Shihezi Town (Shihezi City, Xinjiang) and detained in a re-education camp. This was part of the ramped-up efforts to persecute Muslims in Xinjiang under the pretext of ''sinicization of religion''.

Around 15 April 2018 (as reported), a female petitioner was taken by police in Beijing and sent to the ''Gaojiachang black jail'' in Fengtai District (Beijing). Upon arrival at the black jail, she was searched by some government stability maintenance people and hired triad members. They also slapped her and beat her with electric baton. She received multiple injuries.

Around 15 April 2018 (from 15-16 April), 1 member of The Church of Almighty God was arrested and tortured in a police station in Xinyi City (Xuzhou City, Jiangsu Province). As the church member refused to answer interrogation, the police scolded him and cuff his hands behind his back with a pair of serrated handcuffs. The police threatened him, punched his thighs with his fist and did not allow him to sleep at night. The man's thighs were swollen and aching from the beating. The man and another 3 church members who were arrested altogether were detained separately in iron cages. Police continued to abuse the man the next day, slapping him with shoes, puching and kicking him, as well as depriving him of food and sleep. The man was left bleeding from the corners of his mouth. He and the 3 other church members were transferred to a detention centre on 17 April and finally released on 27 April.

Around 15 April 2018 (month of), more than 50 people, including the village's imam, were detained and imprisoned in Lanzhouwan conversion centres in Lanzhouwan town (Changji Hui Autonomous, Xinjiang Uygur Autonomous Region). They and their off-springs were consequently put on the blacklist and stripped of many basic rights as citizens, such as the right to a university education, employment, an opportunity to take civil service exams and the right to join the military.

Around 15 April 2018 (month of), more than 40 Muslim men from the same vilage in Wusu (Tarbagatay, Xinjiang) were taken by authorities to a ''transformation through education'' camp after being tricked by authorities to visit the local commune for ''study classes.''

Around 15 April 2018 (month of), police officers took away a student in Jiangsu, who was reported to have a book of the Church of Almighty God in his home. The police officers gave him electric shock in his face six times and beat his legs with a wooden club.

Around 15 April 2018 (month of), more than 30 young Kazakhs was taken by the local authority in Bo'erbosong Village (Ili, Xinjiang) and sent to ''political education camp'' according to the relatives of the Kazakhs. They had yet been released at the time of reporting on September 2018. It is a part of a governmental campaign to suppress the Kazakh ethnic minorities in Xinjiang.

Around 15 April 2018 (month of), a petitioner who was placed under house arrest was beaten up by triad group and drug users hired by the local stability maintenance personnel at his house in Wanzhou District of Chongqing. He was left injured with ruptured eardrums, brain concussion, cervical spine damages and soft tissue damages.

Around 15 April 2018 (month of), an ethnic Kazakh artist from Ili Prefecture, Xinjiang was sent to a 'political study concentration camp' without any reason provided. It was reported that she is being held in Hoboksar County (Tacheng, Xinjiang), but her exact location is unknown and her family has not been able to visit her since. On 4 January 2019, it was reported that she was sentenced to three years' imprisonment in a secret trial.

On 15 April 2018, a petitioner was forcibly taken to detention by police while at the Beijing International Film Festival in Huairou District, Beijing. He was pushed to the ground, his phone was taken, and he was forcibly put in a police car and taken to a police station, where he was reported to have been violently treated. During this incident, a group of 11 petitioners who were present at the scene were taken away by police and detained for more than 24 hours.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Uyghur Ethnic Group (China); CPC: Communist Party of China
NOTES: Around 15 April 2018 (month of), a Uyghur man who had been a Communist Party member for over 30 years was taken away by the authorities from Toksun City (Turpan, Xinjiang) and presumably detained in a re-education camp. No official reason was reported for his detention, but his son reported that his father had been released on 19 October 2019 after 1.5 years of detention, after they were able to have a video call for a few minutes.
Around 15 April 2018 (month of), a Uyghur man from Bashipuqiakeqi village (Hotan prefecture, Xinjiang) was detained by the authorities and sent to a re-education camp.

Around 15 April 2018 (month of), a Uyghur businessman was arrested in Yining city (Ili, Xinjiang) and detained incommunicado. Reports later circulated that he had been sentenced to either 18 years or life in prison. The reasons for his detention remain unknown.

Around 15 April 2018 (month of), a Uyghur comedian from Songtake township (Kizilsu, Xinjiang) was taken away by the police and briefly detained incommunicado. The reason for the detention was not clear. It was reported that he was sentenced to 18 years in prison in late 2019 for religious extremism and separatism.

On 16 April 2018, a female petitioner was taken away from Beijing South Station in Fengtai District (Beijing) by government interceptors from Shaanxi province. She called other people while she was taken, but then her phone was switched off quickly. She remained missing by the time of report on 17 April 2018. There was no further report on this event.

On 17 April 2018, a dissident from Rongchang District, Chongqing was taken away by the police from Rongchang District (Chongqing), and detained in a psychiatric hospital for the seventh time. He had yet been released at the time of reporting on 21 May 2018. He had been detained multiple times by the police since 2008 for his commentaries on the internet, which were critical of the Communist Party of China.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Private Security Forces (China); Unidentified Armed Group (China)
NOTES: On 18 April 2018, a man was beaten up in Wenfeng District (Anyang, Henan) while defending his home from being demolished by more than 300 people, including law enforcement and police personnel, people from security companies, and gangsters. The man had first climbed onto the roof of his house and was hit with a water gun before being beaten up by the gangsters. He was then detained by police for 10 days.

On 19 April 2018, some ruffians employed by a real estate company assaulted farm villagers in Lanshuicun (Qingcheng District, Qingyuan, Guangdong) while the villagers tried to stop them taking their land. A peasant woman holding a two-years old child was knocked to the ground and lost consciousness. Police were called but refused to take any action. The company had reportedly been working with local government to illegally seizing land from over 600 households in Lanshuicun since 2002. Villager tried to petition to superior governments but faced all sorts of oppression from the local government.

On 19 April 2018, three petitioners were beaten by black security guards hired by the government at a deserted area in the countryside near Yunxi County, Shiyan, Hubei, after they were returned from Beijing when attempting to petition at the National Bureau for Letters and Calls.

On 19 April 2018, a Uyghur man from Moyu municipality (Hotan, Xinjiang) was detained and sent to a re-education camp. His current status is unknown and no official reason has been given for his arrest, but the reasons stated on his record discovered in a leaked government file were: being designated as a person from a 'special group' and having 1-2 children more than allowed by family planning policy.

On 20 April 2018, over 60 Three-Self Church members tried to block ten police officers from entering their church in Qingfeng county, Henan. Four elderly Christians were shoved to the ground and dragged into police cars during the heated exchange, which occurred after local officials said they will be changing the name of the church. Days later, authorities cut off water, electricity and gas to the church when believers opposed the transfer of land rights to the village committee.

On 20 April 2018, two police officers arrested a non-Muslim, Han Chinese man at his home in Shihezi, justifying their arrest by connecting the ability to speak Uyghur with being associated with Muslims. They placed him in a ''transformation through education camp'' for ten days.

On 22 April 2018, more than a dozen petitioners were met by local officials and security guards at the Cangshan International Convention and Exhibition Center (Cangshan District, Fuzhou). Local Gushan Town Government officers took a woman petitioner to Tongleyuan black prison in Guiling, Jin'an. Several other petitioners at the scene were also reported to have been arrested and threatened by local officials and security guards.

On 23 April 2018, the director of Zhoukou's Department of Justice, leading 2 police officers and 17 offenders serving time outside of prison, beat up believers in a Three-Self Protestant church in Nanjiao Township of Chuanhui District (Zhoukou City, Henan Province.) The officials interrogated believers one by one and beat up people if they refused to give up their faith. An offender grabbed a man's arms while another offender slapped him, blood running from the corners of the man's mouth.

On 23 April 2018, six Three-Self Church preachers from Qinghai were arrested by the police in Urumqi city, Xinjiang, and all of them were slapped, kicked and beaten in custody. One of the men had severe bruises and swelling, and could neither squat nor stand. He was hospitalised later that night due to the severity of his bleeding.

On 24 April 2018, a petitioner from Wanshougonggong village of Dongxihu district - now living in Qiaokou district (Wuhan, Hubei) - was sent to a 'black jail' by hired men ('evil forces') working for the CPC Secretary of Cihui Subdistrict of Dongxihu district. During her detention, the men forced her into signing an eviction agreement on behalf of her family. She was held at a 'black jail' for 112 days.

On 26 April 2018, a petitioner-cum-human rights defender was beaten by 3 ruffians employed by local ''stability maintenance'' authority near his home in Wanzhou district (Chongqing) reportedly because he posted some comments to support the march of the wife of the ''709 lawyer''. He was beaten for almost half an hour. Police was called to the scene but accused everyone at the scene of ''picking quarrels''. He went to the hospital on the day after and suffered from headache and nausea.

Around 27 April 2018 (between 24 - 29 April), an Uzbek businessman arrested in Yining city (Ili, Turpan, Xinjiang) and taken to a re-education camp. The reasons for his detention are not certain, but it is alleged that his visit to his son in Turkey and his pilgrimage to Mecca may have been influencing factors, while he has also been accused of being inclined to pan-turkism in the past. He was later tried in a closed trial on 8 October 2019. The verdict of his trial and his current status are still unknown.

On 28 April 2018, a man was seized, attacked and tortured by a dozen hired gangsters in Rudong County, Jiangsu. The man and his wife were driving back from a social gathering and were hit by a surveillance van. The man continued driving despite the accident but was intercepted by another vehicle and attacked by more than a dozen gangsters. The couple's phones were robbed, the man was beaten with an electroshock weapon, and his mouth was restrained with a cloth gag. The man was then dragged into the gangsters' vehicle and taken to an unknown house while continuing to suffer beatings and electric shocks. At the house, his clothes were torn and he was splashed with cold water while forced to lie down on the floor, and his body was stepped on. The gangster said they were sent because of the house demolition and threatened that if he did not sign his consent for compensation agreement for demolition, he would be killed. The man was punched, kicked and slapped until signing a compensation agreement.
On 28 April 2018, the sister of a Uyghur political refugee living in Sweden was sent to re-education centre in Urumuqi, Xinjiang. [women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons]

Around 29 April 2018 (from 28 to 30 April), local police interrogated two villagers for three days and nights without sleep in Wanzhai Village (Sanming, Fujian). The villagers had been arrested on 28 April for ''directing other villagers to destroy a mining company'' and ''disturbing social order'' and detained for a total of 32 days.

SOURCE: China Aid; RFI; Weiquanwang; CRLW; Radio Free Asia
NOTES: On 29 April 2018, a human rights activist from Hunan was arrested by police in Suzhou (Jiangsu) while he was visiting the graveyard of a well-known political dissident that was executed by the government in 1968 for the crime of ''anti-revolution''. His last known location was Xukou Police Station at Xukou Town (Suzhou, Jiangsu)--where he was taken to be questioned and held incommunicado. It was later reported on 22 May 2018 that he was placed under ''Residential Surveillance'', possibly in a hotel in Suzhou, and was criminally charged later.

On 30 April 2018, three female believers of The Church of Almighty God were arrested in Bali town of Yangzhou (Jiangsu) after plainclothes police officers broke into one of their homes, seizing Church property and personal valuables. One of them was released on May 15, but the other two were taken to Chunxiao Hotel for secret interrogations and their whereabouts remain unknown three months later.

On 1 May 2018, seven rights activists from Chongqing went missing for three days after participating in the ''National Resonance'' event and having a meal together. Two of the activists were freed on 4 May but not allowed to communicate online or be interviewed by foreign media. By the time of report on 5 May 2018, there was still one person's whereabouts remaining unknown.

On 1 May 2018, a Green Leaf Initiative advocate disappeared at Jiefangbei Square in Yuzhong, Chongqing, after walking about wearing a green leaf on his shirt as part of the ''National Resonance'' event. There was no further news about his whereabouts by the time of report on 5 May 2018.

Around 1 May 2018 (between 16 April - 16 May), a Muslim woman who had been arrested along with 27 other Muslims in Manas county (Changji, Xinjiang) around 16 April 2018 died in police custody. She had been detained for 20 days following her first arrest on 17 March, and was arrested again 10 days after she was released.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Hui Ethnic Group (China); Muslim Group (China); Women (China)
NOTES: On 1 May 2018, government officials took a Hui Muslim woman in for questioning in Xinjiang after she was heard mentioning the Quran at her own home. They had interrogated her and her husband the day before, and released her prior to taking her away again on 1 May. As of August 2018, her whereabouts were still unknown.

Around 1 May 2018 (week of), an 84-year-old retired professor of Shandong University was detained and held incommunicado at a military reception house in the rural area of Jinan City, Shandong Province. He was under 24 hours surveillance and had his mobile phone confiscated. He was detained for 43 days until June 15th and immediately placed under house arrest. It was reported that his detention was due to a crackdown on dissenters before and during the 29th anniversary of June 4th student movement and President Xi Jinping's visit to Jinan City.

On 1 May 2018, a Uyghur man from Moyu municipality (Hotan, Xinjiang) was detained and sent to Qaraqash No. 2 re-education camp. His current status is unknown and no official reason has been given for his arrest, but the reason stated on his record discovered in a leaked government file was for being an unreliable person born in the 1980s. It is reported that he was approved for release in early 2019, but is currently still in camp.

Around 3 May 2018 (as reported), a Baoji petitioner and activist was found out missing in Beijing. In the past, the activist had been persecuted by the government and was nearly killed by stability maintenance forces. Prior to his disappearance, he and fellow villagers were violently intercepted by local security at the State Bureau for Letters and Calls in Xicheng, Beijing on 28 April 2018 when petitioning to express their dissatisfaction regarding local authorities' violent treatment of petitioners.

On 4 May 2018, two human rights activists were taken away by police at Ping'anli West Street in Xicheng District, Beijing. Activists were taken to Gaojiachang black prison No. 46-3 after a group Chongqing activists had their identity documents checked and were intercepted on their way to petition.
