The exact reason for the disappearance was not known, although the priest's last post on social media on 29 Jul expressed a request to authorities to leave his family alone should he be ''arbitrarily sentenced.'' They had been incommunicado for a little over two months at the time of reporting on 12 Oct 2020.

Around 16 August 2020 (month of), three Kazakhs - a retired civil servant and her two sons - went missing in Xinjiang province (coded to Shuimogou), possibly detained in relation to the activism of their husband and father. They were still incommunicado at the time of reporting on 22 Jan 2021. All of them were previously being put into 'transformation-through-education' facilities in Mar 2018, and closely monitored by authorities after release in early 2019.

On 17 August 2020, a petitioner from Caijia (Caijiagang) sub-district, Beibei district (Chongqing) was taken away by local government and police officials and held incommunicado until his release on 1 Sep. When his acquaintances inquired at the sub-district office on 26 Aug, they mentioned that he was 'in quarantine' (alluding to the coronavirus pandemic at the time). The incident was reported as a case of stability maintenance ahead of an international trade conference (CIFTIS 2020) held in Beijing from 4-9 Sep.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of China (2017-) Hong Kong Police Force
SOURCE: Apple Daily Hong Kong; The Stand News
NOTES: On 17 August 2020, 10 immigration officers beat up one of the detainees at Castle Peak Bay Immigration Center, Tuen Mun district (Hong Kong), after the man refused a request on 16 Aug to visit the hospital for a medical checkup amidst his ongoing hunger strike (since late June). He sustained injuries to his wrists, back, arms and legs, and mentioned that urinating would cause 'immense pain' to his bladder at the time of reporting on 21 Aug.

On 19 August 2020, public security officials from Beijing West Train Station assaulted a female petitioner from Chongqing during a soft detention at Huaxiang Hospital in Fengtai district (Beijing). Earlier that day, officers from the Chongqing Liaison Office, Longxi Sub-district Office and Xinpaifang Police Station boarded her train while it stopped at Shijiazhuang train station, and intercepted her trip to Beijing. She was escorted back to Chongqing the next day, 'restrained' at an unreported location then transferred to home surveillance.

On 19 August 2020, a female petitioner-cum-forced evictee visited the Wujiashan Subdistrict Office in Dongxihu district (Wuhan, Hubei) to convey backlogged issues and difficulties about her housing situation, and was beaten in a room on the second floor of the office by three office workers. After she lost consciousness, she was escorted away by police officers, and detained for 24 hours at the Wujiashan Police Station.

On 20 August 2020, a female rights defender was kidnapped and beaten up by a group of unidentified people outside the Jiangbei Huayuan Police Station in Jiangbei district (Chongqing) upon her release. She was intercepted while petitioning in Beijing and brought to the station earlier the same day. The kidnappers removed her trousers then punched and kicked her again after arriving at Beihai Shanzhuang (villa) in Tieshanping (Liangping, Chongqing). The police alluded that the group was sent by subdistrict level government officials. She was admitted to a hospital, and suffered toe fracture, bruises and soft tissue damage. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 20 August 2020, a female petitioner-cum-forced evictee was punched and kicked by a dozen public security and police officers in a car that was leaving the Lijia Police Station in Lijia village (Yubei, Chongqing). She was kidnapped earlier in the day by more than a dozen people (who appeared to be colluding with the police) at Jinshansi station in Liangjiang New Area (Chongqing). She was then taken by the police to the Fengdu Public Security Bureau in Fengdu county (Chongqing), where she was tied to a tiger bench. She was reportedly detained overnight until her release the next day. She had been a target of the state in the past 20 years for her petitioning.

On 27 August 2020, near dawn, about 400 police officers and local officials came to a Buddhist temple Taihu county (Anqing, Anhui) to implement a demolition order, and chased away six believers guarding the temple by shocking them with electric batons. One elderly man died on the spot from a cardiac arrest induced by the shocks.

On 28 August 2020, a female petitioner-cum-forced evictee was assaulted by a police officer near the CPC Committee Office of Shenxi village of Jiangyin county (Wuxi, Jiangsu) while explaining that her father needed to rest on a public bench. She was hospitalised with injuries sustained to her ribs and brain.

On 29 August 2020, a group of around 10 black-clad men punched, kicked and attacked three white-clad and black-clad teenagers with glass bottles, axes and hiking poles at Chi Cheong Road, Sheung Shui, North district (Hong Kong). The attack took place near the North District City Hall, where a memorial wall and an outdoor flowerbed for two deceased anti-ELAB demonstrators were set up. The assaulted victims were reportedly paying tribute at the memorial before the attack.

On 31 August 2020, a female human rights defender from Yuzhong district, Chongqing had her ID checked and was then sent to Qinglonghu police station in Fangshan district (Beijing), and transferred to Jiujingzhuang 'black jail.' She was incommunicado as of 3 Sep after being escorted away on 1 Sep by a liaison officer from Chongqing. The incident was reported as a case of stability maintenance ahead of an international trade conference (CIFTIS 2020) held in Beijing from 4-9 Sep. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

Around 1 September 2020 (several consecutive days after arrest), a Catholic Father from the Diocese of Mindong was tortured by police officers during interrogation at a detention house in Fu'an county (Mindong, Fujian). They tortured him by causing sleep deprivation, banging a gong next to his ear and shining a bright light into his eyes for several consecutive days.

On 1 September 2020, two human rights activists from Xiangyang, Hubei were intercepted by police officers at Xike station in Fengtai district (Beijing) and sent to Jiujingzhuang 'black jail.' The incident was reported as a case of stability maintenance ahead of an international trade conference (CIFTIS 2020) held in Beijing from 4-9 Sep.

On 5 September 2020, a Uyghur woman was taken from her home and forcibly admitted to the Yining City People's Hospital (Ili Kazak Autonomous, Xinjiang) by public security officers, just one day following her release from 16 months in Yining City Detention Centre (YCDC). Though they did not specify why she was taken, authorities subsequently warned the victim's cousin - who lived abroad in Sweden - against any advocacy on social media. It could be purported that the victim's quick return to state custody was due to her cousin's tweet about the release. On 5 Dec 2020, her cousin's mother was asked to bring winter clothes to the YCDC. Hospital staff confirmed that the victim had been transferred since 10 days ago. [women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons]

On 7 September 2020, a female Church of Almighty God member was tortured during police interrogation while detained in Xinyi county (Xuzhou, Jiangsu) in order to obtain information about CAG leaders and finances. She was slapped across the face, and shocked in the chest, back, neck and arms with an electric baton. 71 CAG members were arrested in Xuzhou in the month of Sep 2020 as part of a nationwide operation to eradicate The Church of Almighty God in the next three years, as ordered through a confidential document issued by The Central Political and Legal Affairs Commission in Sep 2020.

SOURCE: Xinjiang Victims Database; Radio Free Asia
NOTES: Around 8 September 2020 (between 6 - 10 September), a Uyghur man was taken away by the police in Jiangsu Province (coded as Xuanwu) and detained incommunicado, presumably in prison or a 'concentration camp'. His arrest came after he posted a series of videos online criticizing the CPC over rights abuses committed against his family and other Uyghurs in Xinjiang.

Around 15 September 2020 (month of), two female Church of Almighty God members were arrested by the police on separate occasions in Jiangsu province (coded to Xuanwu), and tortured during interrogations. One of them was cuffed to a tiger bench for eight days, and another was slapped and beaten in the head.

On 15 September 2020, local residents were beaten during a demolition operation led by the county government, who dispatched over 100 police officers and workers to demolish a folk religion temple in Xiushui county (Jiujiang, Jiangxi). The residents were beaten and one person suffered a concussion. While local authorities declared that their plans to demolish the temple were suspended, government-hired workers later demolished the temple in the early morning of 17 Sep.

Around 25 September 2020 (from 22 - 28 September), a Church of Almighty God member was subjected to sleep deprivation at a local hotel in Xinyi county (Xuzhou, Jiangsu), where a total of three CAG members were arrested and secretly interrogated for seven days, and nearly 20,000 RMB of personal and church assets were confiscated. 71 CAG members were arrested in Xuzhou in the month of Sep 2020 as part of a nationwide operation to eradicate The Church of Almighty God in the next three years, as ordered through a confidential document issued by The Central Political and Legal Affairs Commission in Sep 2020.

On 26 September 2020, a female petitioner was kicked and beaten up by stability maintenance officers and 6-7 triad members at her home in Pingzhou village of Heyao township, Xiangdong district (Pingxiang, Jiangxi). They had been guarding her house since intercepting her the day before at the Pingxiang Bureau of Letters and Calls, where she petitioned for compensation of housing damages due to a government mining operation.

On 28 September 2020, a female rights-defending petitioner was reportedly assaulted by on-duty police officers at the reception hall of the Hubei Letters and Visits Bureau in Wuchang district (Wuhan, Hubei), as witnessed by another female petitioner who was at the Bureau at the same time. She was then taken by the police to the police room, but it was not reported how long she was in the police room for. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 30 September 2020, a petitioner from Heping district, Shenyang was kidnapped and assaulted by several hired men near the Dadushe Police Station in Dadushe village of Majuqiao town (Tongzhou, Beijing). He was taken into a car with a Liaoning provincial police car plate, and beaten until became unconscious. The victim was admitted to a hospital at Suizhong county (Huludao, Liaoning) but became unconscious again, during which he was transferred by car to the Xingshun police station in Tiexi district of Shenyang prefecture. The victim was detained despite multiple severe internal organ injuries and fractures, and transferred between four police stations in Shenyang without official documentation until release on 6 November 2020.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Buddhist Group (China); Prisoners (China); Tibetan Ethnic Group (China)
NOTES: Around 1 October 2020 (beginning of month), a Tibetan monk from the Dza Wonpo monastery in Dza Wonpo Village, Shiqu County (Garze Tibetan Autonomous Region, Sichuan Province) had to be collected from prison due to his medication condition, namely serious injuries, acute respiratory infection and the inability to speak or move. It was believed to be a result of beatings, malnourishment and mistreatment in custody. He had lost consciousness upon hospital admission on 9 Oct, and was reported that he had been in critical condition for 10 days before handed over to his family. He died around 1 Dec 2020.

On 9 October 2020, a petitioner from Wuxi, Jiangxi was strangled and beaten by a public security officer and interceptors while being chased from outside the National Bureau of Letters and Calls in Xicheng District (Beijing) (coded as Beijing-Xicheng), where he was filing a petition against his local government after escaping from house arrest. He was taken to Jinghua Hotel, then escorted back to Wuxi by hired workers. He was charged for ''provoking troubles,'' and resumed being under house arrest.

On 9 October 2020, a female rights defender-cum-vaccine campaigner and her family were taken away by the police in Hui (Huixian) county (Xinxiang, Henan), and held incommunicado in 'unofficial detention with no paperwork.' They were still incommunicado and believed to be under house arrest at an unknown government-designated location at the time of reporting on 27 Oct 2020. She was taken away after splashing ink on a government building in protest against unsafe vaccines. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 12 October 2020, a rights activist and organiser from Nanchang prefecture (Jiangxi) (coded to Honggutan) was kidnapped and forcibly admitted to the Jiangxi Province Mental Hospital by the government's stability maintenance department, after authorities received information that he was planning a collective petition for psychological torture victims. He was held for more than two months until release on 16 Dec.

On 13 October 2020, a female petitioner from Qingfeng town was forcibly admitted to a psychiatric hospital after being transferred out of Qingfeng Town Police Station in Qingfeng Town, Fang county (Shiyan, Hubei). The day before, she was intercepted at the Hubei Letters and Visits Bureau in Wuchang district (Wuhan, Hubei) by the police before being transported overnight to her hometown and detained at the police station. She was forcibly administered psychotropic drugs during her detention, which lasted till 18 Dec 2020.

Around 14 October 2020 (between 14 - 15 October), a female petitioner from Xinglong sub-district was beaten and tortured by government-hired 'thugs' while illegally detained at 188 Xinglong Dajie, Jianye district (Nanjing, Jiangsu). She sustained injuries to her right leg while restricted to a room adjacent to the Xinlong Sub-District Office. On 14 Oct, authorities had intercepted her in Beijing for petitioning and released her home, but she was forced to visit to a coronavirus testing centre the next day. She was then isolated despite negative results, and remained detained at the time of reporting on 19 Oct 2020.

Around 16 October 2020 (month of), a Church of Almighty God member from Jiangsu Province (coded to Xuanwu) was arrested and tortured for refusing to disclose information about the CAG. They confined his limbs in iron rings of two tiger benches then moved the benches in opposite directions.

On 17 October 2020, Buddhist believers were stopped and beaten during an operation by ten law enforcement officers and over ten unidentified men to demolish the newly-built walls of the once-demolished the Buddhist Bailong Temple in Jiujiang prefecture (Jiangxi) [coded to Xunyang district].

On 20 October 2020, a petitioner from Chongqing was intercepted by local government officials from a train carriage in Zhengzhou prefecture (Henan), his situation remained unknown at the time of reporting on 29 Oct 2020. The incident was reported as a case of stability maintenance in relation to the fifth plenary session of the 19th CPC Central Committee set to commence in Beijing.

On 20 October 2020, a petitioner from Jiangsu was beaten by many unidentified men on Changhan Lu (north of Jingliang Lu) in Changyang town (Fangshan, Beijing) and kidnapped onto a car with a Jiangsu provincial car plate. He was then held at a 'black jail' in Rugao county (Nantong, Jiangsu) from 21 Oct until 24 Oct 2020. The incident was reported as a case of stability maintenance in relation to the fifth plenary session of the 19th CPC Central Committee set to commence in Beijing.

On 21 October 2020, a petitioner from Jiangsu was stripped naked and beaten by five unidentified captors while held at a 'black jail' at Water Conservancy Scenic Spot in Rugao county (Nantong, Jiangsu). He had earlier been kidnapped in Beijing on 20 Oct and was held until 24 Oct 2020. The incident was reported as a case of stability maintenance in relation to the fifth plenary session of the 19th CPC Central Committee set to commence in Beijing.

On 21 October 2020, the mother of an underaged rape victim was then taken to a private hostel (reportedly named ''215 black jail'') within Beijing municipality by Chongqing liaison officers, where she was stripped naked for a body search. She was held there for over 30 hours until 23 Oct, and would be transferred to administrative detention in Chongqing until 3 Nov 2020. She was intercepted by police officers earlier on 21 October 2020 in front of Tiananmen Square in Dongcheng district (Beijing) while on her way to the All-China Women's Federation, intending to appeal the harbouring of sexual criminals and subsequent false imprisonment brought against her by the courts of Dongguan prefecture (Guangdong) and Yunyang county (Chongqing). [women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons]

On 22 October 2020, a human rights lawyer (whose license was revoked since his last RSDL) was taken away from his residence in Fengxiang county (Baoji, Shaanxi) by the Hi-Tech Development Zone Branch of Baoji Public Security Bureau. He was then placed under Residential Surveillance at a Designated Location (RSDL) in a hostel, where he was fixed onto a tiger chair from 22 October 2020 to 27 October 2020 and experienced prolonged interrogation, sleep, and water deprivation for more than five months. The arrest came six days after the victim posted a video on YouTube, sharing details about the torture he experienced during his first RSDL detention (10 days in the month of January). On 7 April 2021, the victim had been transferred to the Feng County Detention Centre in the Qinling (Qin Mountain) regions.

On 23 October 2020, a female petitioner got slapped in the face over 80 times by 'black security guards' on a road trip being repatriated back to Shanghai municipality. She had her teeth loosened and suffered hearing loss after the attack. Upon arrival, she was detained in a 'black jail' for 21 days.

On 24 October 2020, a female petitioner-cum-forced evictee from Qiaokou district, Wuhan was intercepted in Beijing Municipality by police officers from Qiaokou's Changfengjie Police Station and escorted back to Wuhan by car, where she was ''illegally detained'' at a ''black jail'' by police officers until 4 Nov. They confiscated the cash she had and emptied her mobile banking account.

On 24 October 2020, a female rights defender detained by police was made to sit in a torture chair at the Fengdu County Public Security Bureau in Fengdu county (Chongqing) for around 30 minutes. She was first kidnapped near Kaiyang Lane, Fengtai district (Beijing) by police and government officials on 23 Oct and taken to a ''black jail'' room 46-3 Gaojiachang in the same district. On 26 Oct, a Longhe town official and four police officers kidnapped her to Tianhai Shangwu Hostel in Longhe town of Fengdu county (Chongqing). On 27 Oct, a town official confiscated her phone and pressed her against the bed in order to stop her from reporting the incident to the police. She was released on 30 Oct (location coded as Beijing-Fengtai). [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 25 October 2020, government-hired private security personnel abducted a petitioner while he was held in state custody at a detention centre for petitioners at 500 Fucun Rd, Putuo district (Shanghai) (coded as Shanghai-Putuo), and held him incommunicado at Meidu Hotel ''black jail'' in Fengxian district for 18 days.

Around 25 October 2020 (between 21-29 October), a female rights defender-cum-forced evictee from Nanjing was kidnapped by over 10 local government personnel of Xuanwu district (including interceptors, public security officers and Xinjiekou residential district's judicial officers) in front of the liaison office at Su 8 Hotel, Xiluoyuan residential district, Fengtai district (Beijing). She was confined to a room at an unknown location for nine days, and was beaten by police officers during her detention. Her release coincided with the end of the fifth plenary session of the 19th CPC Central Committee held in Beijing (location coded as Beijing-Fengtai). [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 25 October 2020, a rights defender from Minhang district, Shanghai was taken away by government personnel from the Beijing Office from Jiujingzhuang 'black jail' in Fengtai District (Beijing) and repatriated back to Shanghai. Upon arrival at Fucun Road station, Putuo district (Shanghai), he was taken away by government-hired security forces. He remained incommunicado at the time of reporting on 29 Oct 2020, and was suspected to be detained in a 'black jail'. Three other men were also taken away from Jiujingzhuang and repatriated to Shanghai on the same train. The incident was reported as a case of stability maintenance in relation to the fifth plenary session of the 19th CPC Central Committee set to commence in Beijing.

On 26 October 2020, a female petitioner from Hongkou, Shanghai was captured by an unreported group of people near the Great Hall of the People, Xicheng district (Beijing). She was escorted back to Shanghai, but her circumstances had remained unknown at the time of reporting on 29 Oct 2020. The incident was reported as a case of stability maintenance in relation to the fifth plenary session of the 19th CPC Central Committee that had commenced in Beijing.

On 26 October 2020, two rights defenders from Chongqing were beaten by their captors while being held at a ''black jail,'' room 46-3 Gaojiachang in Fengtai district (Beijing), one of whom vomited afterwards. The rights defenders had been intercepted by the police in Beijing earlier that day, and temporarily detained in Fuyou Street Police Station and Jiujingzhuang ''black jail'', before being transferred to Gaojiachang. Both were escorted back to the Liangjiang New Area (Chongqing) by seven people the following night, and left on the roadside (location coded as Beijing-Fengtai).

On 26 October 2020, a female rights defender from Chongqing was beaten at 46-3 Gaojiachang, Yuquanying in Fengtai district (Beijing), after the police brought her into Fuyoumen Street police station earlier that day. The incident was reported as a case of stability maintenance in relation to the fifth plenary session of the 19th CPC Central Committee that had commenced in Beijing. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Buddhist Group (China); Teachers (China); Tibetan Ethnic Group (China)
NOTES: On 26 October 2020, a Tibetan monk from the Kirti monastery in Ngawa Tibetan and Qiang Autonomous prefecture - and Buddhist scholar and educator, vocal on democratic rights and advocacy for academic freedom in monastic education settings, was held in incommunicado detention in Chengdu prefecture (Sichuan) (coded to Wuhou). His whereabouts and reason for arrest were still unknown at the time of reporting on 9 April 2021. It was reported that security personnel from Tibet crossed provincial borders to make the arrest.

On 26 October 2020, a female petitioner was taken away by a group of Jiaxing sub-district workers and triad members outside Jiaxing Police Station in Hongkou district (Shanghai) (coded to Shanghai-Hongkou). Her fingers were reportedly bleeding after she was violently taken into the van. She was then locked up in Room 8601 ''black jail'' at Hanting Hotel, No.4, Long 1063, Zhoujiazui Road in the same district until her escape on 8 Nov 2020.

On 27 October 2020, a rights defender from Jing'an district, Shanghai was intercepted by local government personnel in Beijing municipality and brought back to Shanghai, after which he remained incommunicado at the time of reporting on 29 Oct 2020. The incident was reported as a case of stability maintenance in relation to the fifth plenary session of the 19th CPC Central Committee that had commenced in Beijing.

On 28 October 2020, a female petitioner was harassed and assaulted by an unidentified person in Fengwu village, Quan'an town of Shizhong district (Neijiang, Sichuan), before disappearing and going incommunicado until she was hospitalised for emergency response on 31 Oct. Prior to this, she was intercepted in Chengdu prefecture and escorted back to her home in Neijiang on 26 Oct, then forbidden by district and town officers from releasing news about the interception (and alleged assault). It was reported that she did not obey the orders and published a post that got some attention on Weixin.

On 28 October 2020, a female petitioner from Shanghai was intercepted in Dongjiaominxiang Police Station in Dongcheng District (Beijing) by police officers and escorted back to Shanghai by train on the same day. She was expected to arrive at Hongqiao Station before midnight, but remained uncontactable at the time of reporting on 2 Nov 2020 (location coded as Beijing-Dongcheng).

Around 28 October 2020 (between 23 October and 3 November), the mother of an underaged rape victim was subjected to torture while she was administratively detained at the Public Security Bureau of Yunyang county (Chongqing). She was also forced to sit on a ''tiger bench'' during interrogation. She was transferred to the Bureau from Beijing by public security officers and officials from the petitioning offices of Yunyang county, Panlong town and her residential district on 23 October 2020, and detained until 3 November 2020. She was held at two ''black jail'' locations in Beijing between 21-23 Oct, after being intercepted on her way to appeal against charges brought against her. [women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons]

On 29 October 2020, a rights defender from Jin'an district, Fuzhou was beaten and kidnapped by local government-hired private security guards while traveling in Beijing municipality, and held at rural guesthouse in Guling, Huanxi township of Jin'an district. His wife found him on 2 Nov 2020, but both of them were subdued. The security guards claimed that they had to be held in ''compulsory detention in training course.'' The event coincided with the end of the fifth plenary session of the 19th CPC Central Committee held in Beijing.

Around 3 November 2020 (between 28 October - 10 November), a female petitioner was beaten by an unreported party and rendered disabled during illegal soft arrest at Hengsha Island (Hengshadao) of Chongming district (Shanghai). On 26 Oct, the victim was intercepted by Huayang Rd Subdistrict government officials and Shanghai liaison officers in Beijing after checking into a hotel in Dahongmen near the People's Supreme Court in Dongcheng district. She was visiting the capital to report unlawful procedures and forgery of documents by local officials during a house expropriation case in 2016.

On 3 November 2020, a female rights defender was beaten by a CPC Committee official at the Longhe Town Government in Longhe town of Fengdu county (Chongqing). She was recently released after being intercepted in Beijing, then kidnapped and held in a ''black jail'' from 23 Oct to 29 Oct. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 12 November 2020, a local pro-democracy activist from Zhuhai prefecture (Guangdong) became incommunicado (coded to Xiangzhou), and continued to be at the time of reporting on 17 November 2020. Four more activists were taken away in Guangzhou, Guangdong by the Ministry of State Security on the same day. The arrests and disappearances were allegedly related and part of the same arrest operation.

On 12 November 2020, four local pro-democracy activists were arrested in Guangzhou (Guangdong) (coded to Guangzhou) by the Ministry of State Security, with one of them confirmed to have been placed under Residential Surveillance at a Designated Location (RSDL) for inciting subversion of state power. The remaining two were still incommunicado at the time of reporting on 17 Nov 2020. Another activist was forcibly admitted to a hospital for the same charges, then transferred to criminal detention at the Guangzhou Ministry of State Security Detention Centre on 27 Jan 2021. The arrests and disappearances were allegedly related and part of the same arrest operation.

On 12 November 2020, the owner of Dawu Agricultural and Animal Husbandry Group and three employees were placed under Residential Surveillance at a Designated Location (RSDL) by Gaobeidian Police Station in Gaobeidian city (Baoding, Hebei) for a slew of offenses, including picking quarrels and stirring up trouble, gathering a crowd to attack an organ of the state, disrupting official duties, illegal mining, and illegal occupation of agricultural land. They were held incommunicado separately in windowless rooms for 3 to 5 months, where they claimed to suffer 'cruel and inhumane treatment.' The detention followed their participation in a mass demonstration at the Xushui District People's Government and Public Security Bureau in Xushui district on 4 August 2020 to stop a state-owned enterprise from demolishing their company building.

Around 14 November 2020 (between 12 November - 16 November), two men from Nianyutao, Jiangqiao sub-district of Gaoxin district of Runzhou district (Zhenjiang, Jiangsu) were beaten by hired personnel at the headquarters of a government-led forced demolition operation in an attempt to coerce them into signing an agreement to the operation. Following their kidnapping on 12 November, they were repeatedly beaten and transferred to various places. One of the men was hospitalised for bone fracture.

Around 15 November 2020 (month of), a Tibetan environmental activist originally from Chaktse village, Biru county was taken from prison to a hospital in Lhasa, where sources say he was suffering from a brain haemorrhage and paralysis following injuries reportedly sustained in prison or beatings by Chinese authorities on the way to the hospital. Authorities did not notify his family about the hospitalization. The victim died on 6 Feb 2021. He was detained on 8 Nov 2013 with no information about his whereabouts, tried in secret, and sentenced to 21 years for his involvement and media engagement in protests against a mining project at Naghla Dzambha Mountain in Biru.

On 19 November 2020, a man was taken away by national security officers in Guangzhou city, Guangdong, and placed under Residential Surveillance at a Designated Location (RSDL) for inciting subversion of state power. He was put under criminal detention on 27 January 2021 and was arrested on 3 March of the same year due to the same charge. The reason for his detention was suspected related to his association with a group of dissentients because a few members of the group had also been detained around the same period.

Around 22 November 2020 (between 12 Nov - 3 Dec), a female rights defender from Guangxi was arrested in Xishuangbanna Dai Autonomous Prefecture (Yunnan) (coded to Jinghong City) by officers from the Guangzhou Bureau of State Security, possibly in connection with the ''11.12 Guangzhou Arrests'' crackdown on dissidents. Her family was notified on 3 Dec that she was placed under Residential Surveillance at a Designated Location (RSDL) on suspicion of subversion. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 22 November 2020, three female employees of Dawu Agricultural and Animal Husbandry Group were placed under Residential Surveillance at a Designated Location (RSDL) by Gaobeidian Police Station in Gaobeidian city (Baoding, Hebei) for picking quarrels and provoking trouble, and gathering a crowd to attack an organ of the state. They were held separately in windowless rooms for more than five months, where one of them was extremely weak and on the verge of a mental breakdown. The detention followed their participation in a mass demonstration at the Xushui District People's Government and Public Security Bureau in Xushui district on 4 August 2020 to stop a state-owned enterprise from demolishing their company building.

On 23 November 2020, an imprisoned female citizen journalist and lawyer was forcibly tube-fed through her nose by fellow prisoners (assumed to be at the behest of prison guards) in her cell in Pudong New Area Detention Centre, Pudong New Area (Shanghai) (coded as Shanghai-Pudong New Area), for undergoing a hunger strike since six months ago. This had happened several times during her imprisonment, leading to stomach pains.

On 30 November 2020, around 10 urban management personnel beat up a shop owner in Luoping county (Qujing, Yunnan) after he refused to let his broom get confiscated. The victim had three ribs fractured.

Around 2 December 2020 (as reported), four villagers were pressed on the ground and beaten by village government-hired thugs during a forced eviction operation in Beiguan village of Yingshan sub-district, Guangshui county (Suizhou, Hubei).

SOURCE: Radio Free Asia; Free Tibet; Phayul
NOTES: On 2 December 2020, police arrested a Tibetan writer and former Buddhist monk in Rebkong (Tongren) county (Malho/Huangnan Tibetan Autonomous, Qinghai), and held him at an undisclosed location. The arrestee had been a long-term advocate of Tibetan culture, language and identity, who most recently published an anthology of poems and online remarks about freedom of expression. His whereabouts remain unknown at the time of reporting on 16 December 2020.

Around 2 December 2020 (as reported), a petitioner was taken on mandatory vacation by public security officials in Beijing municipality after applying for permission to host two protests (including for The National Legal Awareness Day and Human Rights Day) within the month.

On 2 December 2020, a female rights defender from Fuzhou, Fujian was kidnapped by authorities in Beijing municipality after petitioning at the State Bureau for Letters and Calls in Xicheng district (Beijing) (coded as Beijing-Xicheng). She was subsequently detained at Jiujingzhuang ''black jail.'' Government-hired ''black'' security forces escorted her back to her hometown, and continued to hold her incommunicado at Xinfengyangshanzhuang ''black jail'' in Guling, Fuzhou with at least two more women. She was released on 23 Dec 2020. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 9 December 2020, a female member of the banned qigong movement, Zhonggong, was arrested during a joint operation by the Yantai and Zhaoyuan public security bureaus of Shandong province (coded to Lixia) and 're-educated', as announced by government authorities before her trial at the Zhaoyuan City People's Court of Zhaoyuan prefecture (Shandong) on 27 Apr 2021.

On 9 December 2020, a female rights defender and petitioner was kidnapped by the Shimahe sub-district chief at the Chongqing West railway station in Shapingba district (Chongqing) (coded as Chongqing-Shapingba) after returning from a trip. She remained incommunicado at the time of reporting on 22 Dec 2020. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 10 December 2020, a political dissident was detained in Futian district (Shenzhen) (coded as Shenzhen-Futian), and repeatedly assaulted by the police when they brought him to a hospital for nucleic acid testing and blood tests. Earlier that day, the victim was handed an order for immediate detention of nine hours while visiting the Futian District Courts to inquire about the shops that were shuttered and auctioned off during his last imprisonment. Due to widespread public awareness, he was released without further administrative detention.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Labour Group (China); Prisoners (China); Kazakh Ethnic Group (China)
NOTES: Around 14 December 2020, a retired Kazakh chief of the Culture and Sports Bureau in Emin county tortured repeatedly while detained in a re-education camp in Tu'ergun village of Emin county (Ili Kazak Autonomous, Xinjiang), and died on 14 December according to his eldest son. After accusing the Xinjiang government of torturing and killing Kazakh herders in 2018, he became one of the first ''whistle blowers'' to raise awareness about the inner conditions of re-education and internment camps in the region.

Around 18 December 2020, a police officer being detained in Changsha prefecture (Hunan) (coded to Yuelu) for two months in relation to corruption while serving as chief of Yanquan Police Station, was found to have wounds and multiple fractures to his chest, neck, oral and nasal cavities. The wounds were uncovered post-mortem by his family members after the victim died on 18 December while being escorted from where he was detained to a procuratorial organ. On the same day, the District Commission for Discipline Inspection announced that he had been fired from his post.

On 18 December 2020, a man was transferred from Zhuzhou prefecture (Hunan) (coded to Tianyuan) to Residential Surveillance at a Designated Location (RSDL) on the 14th day of his administrative detention. He had been detained for posting online about solidarity with a protester.

Around 19 December 2020 (from 18 - 20 December), a female rights defender was kicked and punched by stability maintenance officers at the Canglang Sub-District Office in Gusu county (Suzhou, Jiangsu) due to arguments during an inquiry about forced eviction compensation. Later, when she was hospitalised, they tried to intervene and prevent doctors from providing her with medical inspection and treatment. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Government of China (2012-); Unidentified Triad Group (China)
NOTES: On 24 December 2020, a female petitioner-cum-forced evictee from Qingyang district, Chengdu was beaten in the head and waist by unknown individuals on the N90E92 night train from Beijing to her hometown. She had visited the capital to inquire about her past interceptions and detentions at various police stations. After her visit to the Fuyoujie Police Station in Xicheng district (Beijing), she was transferred her to a 'relief centre' (for petitioners), after which she was escorted to the night train by government officials from Qingyang and government-hired triad members. She was held at a farmhouse in Chaoyang Lake, Pujiang county on 25 Dec, then transferred to Dekang Psychiatric Hospital in Chengdu on 20 Jan 2021.

On 25 December 2020, a female petitioner from Zhoutun village, Lutun town of Bayuquan district, Yingkou was intercepted by two policemen after entrance inspection at the State Bureau for Letters and Calls in Xicheng district (Beijing) (coded as Beijing-Xicheng). After being taken to a side office to meet with liaison officers, she was escorted back to her hometown, where she was held captive by village government-hired guards and police officers in a windowless room at Yuelunshangwu Hotel at least till 27 Dec 2020.

On 4 January 2021, a petitioner from Chengguan village of Zhushan county (Shiyan, Hubei) was forcibly admitted to a pyschiatric hospital on Beida St of Zhushan county after police officers and village committee officials intercepted him on the way to his daughter's primary school. On 13 Jan, he was transferred to another hospital within the county (Fankou Pyschiatric Hospital), and was found by his family on 16 Jan 2021. The victim was a repeated target of local authorities due to his petitions for demolition compensation, largely in relation to housing damages due to a state highway project in 2002.

Around 16 January 2021 (month of), authorities from Qiatekale township (Xinjiang) detained a Uyghur woman for 'getting involved in a legal matter' after she intervened in a domestic fight between her neighbours, then sent her to an 'internment camp' on suspicion of 'religious extremism'. Though previously recognised by the local village committee as having contributed to social stability in her community - as she led weddings and funerals - her intervention was deemed inappropriate by the village committee, which had been sent to break up the fight.

Around 16 January 2021 (month of), a Uyghur man was moved to a prison in Aksu Prefecture (Xinjiang) (coded to Aksu City) and held in solitary confinement. He was an entrepreneur and founder of a social media app that featured a variety of current affairs and cultural topics, but went missing in April 2016, then was secretly tried and convicted on charges of 'inciting ethnic hatred and ethnic discrimination.' All this time, he had been incommunicado until authorities granted him a three-minute video call with his family in Jan 2021.

Around 16 January 2021 (month of), at least 123 Church of Almighty God members were arrested by the police in Jiangsu province (coded to Xuanwu), of which 17 members were arrested on 14 Jan in Huai'an city. Many were detained at extrajudicial locations like hotels, and subjected to torture during interrogation.

On 19 January 2021, two local petitioners were kidnapped in front of the Great Hall of the People in Liangxi district (Wuxi, Jiangsu), where the Lianghui 'Two Sessions' were being held, by seven or eight public security and government officers of Yinglongqiao Sub-district. They were detained at a 'temporary house' for 24 hours then transferred to a hostel on 21 Jan, where they were expected to stay until the end of the Lianghui.

SOURCE: GardaWorld; United News of India; China Daily
NOTES: On 22 January 2021, an explosion occurred at Building 6 of the First Affiliated Hospital at Zhejiang University's School of Medicine in Shangcheng district (Hangzhou, Zhejiang). Three hospital staff and a patient were injured. One suspect was captured. Social media posts by doctors stated that the suspect - a 'disgruntled' patient who was formerly treated at the hospital - went after nurses with a knife after setting off the two explosives he brought.

On 22 January 2021, a villager was punched and kicked by a government officer from Chengjia town of Pujiang county (Chengdu, Sichuan) for filming a mediation session, led by the local deputy party committee secretary, about compensation for a forced demolition operation.

On 24 January 2021, a civil rights activist was taken by the police in Guiyang prefecture (Guizhou) (coded to Guanshanhu) for unknown reasons, and detained incommunicado by the time of reporting on 28 Jan 2021.

On 25 January 2021, a female petitioner-cum-forced evictee was forcibly taken away at Wutaizha Stadium in Wuchang district (Wuhan, Hubei) by the Hongshan sub-district government's security team, and detained at Huashan 'black jail.' Two days later, authorities explained that as she 'violated the law,' she had to attend 'learning classes' organized by the district government. She was still detained at the time of reporting on 12 Mar 2021.

On 25 January 2021, a female human rights defender from Pingxiang, Jiangxi was intercepted at the National Public Complaints and Proposals Administration in Xicheng district (Beijing) (coded as Beijing - Xicheng) by interceptors from Xiangdong district, Pingxiang, and had since remained uncontactable at the time of reporting on 27 Jan 2021. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 28 January 2021, a human rights activist was intercepted at Pudong International Airport in Pudong New Area (Shanghai) by customs officers, who was stopped from boarding a flight to visit his wife in the United States for 'national security reasons.' He announced that he would go on a hunger strike at the airport to protest against the travel ban, but had since become uncontactable at the time of reporting.

Around 31 January 2021 (between 26 January - 5 February), a man was beaten up by some people during a visit to a factory within 500m of Tuhe village, Gucheng village of Fugou county (Zhoukou, Henan). The victim had been invited to the factory by the person-in-charge, and was beaten up by several people (assumed to be hired by the factory) when he arrived. He was hospitalised after sustaining damages to his cranium, eyes and face. Previously, the victim had called the Environmental Bureau on 20 Jan to file an anonymous complaint against the factory for river contamination.

On 1 February 2021, three petitioners from Zoujiachang, Jiujiang town were intercepted by the town's government officials around 300m from the Sichuan People's Government Reception Office for People's Visit in Qingyang district (Chengdu, Sichuan), and two of the women were beaten during the car ride back to their hometown. They sustained injuries to their knee and waist.

On 6 February 2021, a woman from Zhuzhou City was forcibly admitted to a psychiatric ward at No.3 Hospital in Zhuzhou prefecture (Hunan) (coded to Tianyuan) by authorities. The exact reason was unknown, but it was the third time she was forcibly admitted to a psychiatric ward after she splashed ink on a public portrait of President Xi Jinping on July 2018.

On 8 February 2021, a rights defender was assaulted by two residential district and stability maintenance officials from Hongshan town while he was waiting to meet a high-level official at the Gulou District Government Offices (Fuzhou, Fujian), planning to follow up on his wife's complaint case about forced farmland evictions. He was hospitalised for his injuries.

On 11 February 2021, two petitioners from Hubei flagged by facial recognition technology were intercepted by police officers in Zhongguan village residential district of Haidian district in Beijing (coded as Beijing - Haidian) and sent to Jiujingzhuang 'black jail' for detention. Since 2018, they had become a surveillance target since reporting unlawful behaviors and corruption.

On 17 February 2021, a Tibetan teenager was beaten and tortured by the police until his legs were broken after his arrest in Jiegu subdistrict of Yushu township (Yushu Tibetan Autonomous, Qinghai). He was hospitalised in Xining at the time of reporting on 4 Mar 2021, and his family was threatened not to inform anyone of the matter. The victim was one of three teenagers who founded a WeChat group named after a local Buddhist deity - it was suspected that they were arrested for forgetting to register the group with local authorities.

On 18 February 2021, a petitioner from Dongxin district, Pudong New Area was taken away by government-hired security guards at a high-speed railway station in Shanghai municipality, after she had been intercepted at the Beijing train station by personnel from the Zhuqiao town government and escorted back overnight. She remained not contactable at the time of reporting on 22 Feb 2021.

On 18 February 2021, a rights defender from Putuo district, Shanghai was injected with poison and tortured during detention at a 'black jail' in Xinbei village, Huangshadaogang town of Chongming district (Shanghai). She was abducted earlier that day by officials of the Wanli Residential District Government Committee while petitioning in Beijing about an assault case involving her mother. When she was finally released home on 10 Mar, she was in poor health and unable to stand, before eventually passing away on 11 Apr 2021. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 19 February 2021, a petitioner from Tang town, Pudong New Area was petitioning about homelessness at the Ministry of Civil Affairs in Beijing, when he was stopped by police officers patrolling nearby and taken into custody at the Wangfujing Police Station in Dongcheng district (coded as Beijing - Dongcheng). On the same day, he was picked up by liaison officers and held at Su8 Hotel on Kaiyang Ln, Fengtai district, then on 20 Feb, transferred to Hanting Hotel near Heiyao Factory in Xicheng district. On 21 Feb, he was handed over to interceptors from his hometown, and escorted back to Shanghai via high-speed rail in the morning.

On 20 February 2021, a petitioner-cum-forced evictee was placed under Residential Surveillance at a Designated Location (RSDL) following her arrest by the Liangxi District Public Security Sub-Bureau (Wuxi, Jiangsu) for picking quarrels and provoking troubles. The victim was one of six petitioners targeted after taking a group photo at the Great Hall of the People Square in Wuxi City in Jan 2021. While three of them were arrested late night on 28 Jan, the victim and the remaining three ignored and refused to be summoned.

On 20 February 2021, a rights defender was taken away near his residence in Shanghai municipality by five police officers and two security guards as part of stability maintenance efforts before the annual Lianghui meetings. A warrant for criminal detention was already issued at the time, but it was reported that his location remained unknown at the time of reporting on 23 Feb 2021. Prior to the incident, on 19 Feb, local police officers had visited him and his wife, demanding to detain him at a 'vacation village' for one month.

On 21 February 2021, a labour rights activist working for a state-owned railway construction company in Nangang district, Harbin was kidnapped by triad members at the Chaoyang Train Station in Chaoyang district (Beijing) (coded to Beijing - Chaoyang). The incident was reported on 24 Feb 2021 as one of many stability maintenance efforts ahead of the annual Lianghui meetings.

On 22 February 2021, around 20 petitioners from Shunde district, Foshan were intercepted by around 20 petition interceptors at multiple locations in Beijing municipality, and remained uncontactable since the afternoon until the time of reporting on 24 Feb 2021. The incident was reported as one of many stability maintenance efforts ahead of the annual Lianghui meetings.

On 24 February 2021, a petitioner from Xinan residential district was kidnapped by three Xin'anhuayuan community workers at the 760 Public Bus Station outside the entrance of Xin'anhuayuan community in Xinwu district (Wuxi, Jiangsu), and beaten up after they drove her to some barren site. Though she was on her way to grocery shopping at the time, the incident was reported as related to stability maintenance efforts ahead of the annual Lianghui meetings. She was beaten unconscious, and upon waking up, realized that her documents, money and mobile phone were stolen. She sustained soft tissue damage and injuries to her tendons.

On 24 February 2021, a mother and daughter - at least one of whom is a rights defender, subpoenaed on the day - were denied entry to Chongqing No.5 Intermediate People's Court in Yuzhong district (coded to Chongqing-Yuzhong) during security inspections, then beaten up by several black-clad men in the stairwell of the administrative hall in Zhongya Building on Renhe St. When they reported the incident to the police, they explained that the matter was out of their hands as they were not as powerful as the courts. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders][women targeted: girls]

Around 25 February 2021 (month of), a Tibetan political prisoner was released in Garze Tibetan Autonomous Prefecture (Sichuan) (coded to Kangding City) due to precarious health resulting from torture, after serving nine years of a 10-year prison term. While in prison, the victim was tortured and transferred to 'black jails' several times for his 'repeated protests against inhumane treatment towards other prisoners.' He was one of 11 Tibetans detained for peacefully protesting against 'Chinese rule in Tibet' at the time of the Tibetan New Year in 2012.

On 27 February 2021, a petitioner from Liangzuhu district was held at a hostel 'black jail' in Taihe town (Ezhou, Hubei), after he was taken into a seven-seat van driven by three members of an unfamiliar party at the intersection in front of Qianzhang village of Haidian district (Beijing) (coded as Beijing - Haidian). He was still being held in the black jail at the time of reporting on 1 Mar 2021. This was one of many stability maintenance efforts ahead of the annual Lianghui meetings.

On 28 February 2021, a Suzhou petitioner Zhu Yongjian was beaten up by a group led by Xukou Town Petition Bureau authority as he was about to board a train at the Suzhou North Railway Station in Xiangcheng district (Suzhou, Jiangsu). The crowd and the victim called the police several times to no avail. The incident was reported on 1 Mar 2021 as one of many stability maintenance efforts ahead of the annual Lianghui meetings.

On 2 March 2021, a dozen members of the Guizhou Human Rights Research Centre were collectively 'taken on mandatory vacation' by the Guizhou Public Security Bureau to the countryside of Guiyang prefecture (Guizhou) (coded to Guanshanhu). The 'vacation' is expected to last ten days. It was reported that GHKRC members were frequently arranged to leave for the countryside during 'politically sensitive' periods such as the Lianghui meetings and the June Fourth anniversaries. They were reported to have been gradually returned home during 11-12 Mar 2021.

On 2 March 2021, a member of the Guizhou Human Rights Research Centre was tortured at a detention centre after being arrested at his residence by six police officers and the Deputy Chief of Huaxi District State Security (Guiyang, Guizhou). He was tied to a long bench and subject to 30 hours of sleep deprivation. He was released on 13 Mar 2021 with police officers refusing to give evidence of an arrest warrant and charges.

On 2 March 2021, five petitioners from Shanghai were intercepted by authorities and held at Chongmingdao 'black jail' in Chongming district (Shanghai) (coded as Shanghai-Chongming). The incident was reported on 4 Mar 2021 as one of many stability maintenance efforts in relation to the annual Lianghui meetings.

On 2 March 2021, a female rights defender from Chongqing was beaten by three government-hired men in a car parked outside of Huazhong Hotel in Baoding prefecture (Hebei) (coded to Jingxiu), where they reportedly tried to escort her to a hotel room. Earlier that day, she was on her way to Beijing via train when police officers from the Xi'an North Railway Station Police Station tried to prevent her from boarding under a request for investigation from the Rongchang District Public Security Bureau (Chongqing). She boarded the train, but was robbed and escorted away via car upon her arrival at Gaobeidian East Railway Station in Gaobeidian (Baoding, Hebei). [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 3 March 2021, around midnight, Xiantai Sub-district Police Station (Yubei, Chongqing) officers visited a female petitioner at her house. She became uncontactable, and her situation remained unknown at the time of reporting on 8 Mar 2021. The incident was reported as one of multiple stability maintenance efforts carried out against Chongqing petitioners during the annual Lianghui conventions.

On 3 March 2021, a female petitioner was illegally kidnapped in Beijing municipality by officers from the Letters and Calls Bureau of Qiaokou District (Wuhan, Hubei). She was escorted back to her hometown, and detained for one day and one night at Donghua Hotel 'black jail' in Dongxihu District, Wuhan. She was then received by 'evil forces' hired by the Hanzheng Residential District Government, and transferred to a second hotel 'black jail' location at the Wucheng Zhuanshi Hotel in Qiaokou district. She was released on 17 Mar 2021.

On 4 March 2021, a rights defender placed under house arrest in Sanfangqixiang subdistrict of Gulou district (Fuzhou, Fujian) was beaten by local authorities when he expressed wishes to leave the house. The incident was reported on 5 Mar 2021 as one of many stability maintenance efforts during the annual Lianghui meetings.

On 4 March 2021, a farmer from Nancai village (Wuqing, Tianjin) was abducted by officers from the district- and village-level government, and locked up at Yangcungelinhaotai Hotel 'black jail' in order to prevent him from petitioning during the annual Lianghui conventions. He was transferred to Defei Hotel 'black jail' the next day, where he continued to be detained at the time of reporting on 12 Mar 2021.

On 4 March 2021, a petitioner from Luoxi town of Xibei district, Changzhou was having lunch in Dachang county (Langfang, Hebei), when local officials restrained him then detained him at a hotel. The incident was reported as one of multiple stability maintenance efforts carried out against petitioners nationwide during the annual Lianghui conventions.

On 4 March 2021, a female petitioner was beaten up by 'evil forces' hired by the Hanzheng Residential District Government of Qiaokou District (Wuhan, Hubei) while detained at Wucheng Zhuanshi Hotel 'black jail' (in the mentioned Residential District). She became unconscious and was left unattended without basic sustenance for two days. She was released on 17 Mar 2021.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of China (2012-) People's Armed Police
NOTES: On 5 March 2021, several Tibetans, who had posted on social media expressing concern about the police torture and death of a young Buddhist monk, were taken away by the Snow Wolf Commandos (a unit of the paramilitary People's Armed Police) in Wonpo township of Ganzi prefecture (Sichuan) (coded to Kangding City). Their identities and whereabouts remained unknown at the time of reporting on 7 Apr 2021. Dozens of police and commandos launched an operation to 'clean up Tibetan households' among the 3000 residents of Wonpo. They allegedly confiscated materials deemed critical of Chinese rule, such as photos of the Dalai Lama, put up portraits of Chinese leaders in houses, and ordered local residents to download an app to give officials access to data on their mobile phones.

On 5 March 2021, on the first day of the annual Lianghui conventions, a female petitioner living in Changning district (Shanghai) was invaded at their residence by an unreported party during her sleep, who attacked her with a knife and left her with a cut around her right ankle. Leading up to the incident, she had been in discussion with the Huayang Rd Sub-district's newly appointed Head of Petitions, who promised to resolve all her petitioning efforts and stability maintenance incidents locally. At the time of the attack, she already agreed - in good faith - to cancel her visit to the People's Supreme Court in Beijing, where she planned to report unlawful procedures and forgery of documents by local officials during a house expropriation case in 2016.

On 5 March 2021, a petitioner was kidnapped into a car at an intersection at Xinnan Rd near Xin'an Agricultural Market in Xinwu district (Wuxi, Jiangsu) by two plainclothes officers and beaten up, causing injuries to his back and fingers. An official from Xin'an residential district was behind the wheel. The incident was reported as one of multiple stability maintenance efforts carried out against petitioners nationwide during the annual Lianghui conventions.

On 6 March 2021, a female petitioner from Wangcang county, Sichuan was injured by 5-6 liaison officers when she was forced to board a car at the Sichuan Province People's Government Liaison Office in Dongcheng district (Beijing) (coded as Beijing - Dongcheng), where she had been held overnight. They tugged on her hair and stomped on her disabled leg. She was escorted to Guangyuan prefecture, then transferred to the custody of police officers from her hometown, and forcibly admitted to the psychiatric ward at No.4 People's Hospital on 7 Mar. The incident was reported as one of multiple stability maintenance efforts carried out against petitioners nationwide during the annual Lianghui conventions.

On 6 March 2021, a petitioner from Fuding of Ningde prefecture, Fujian was beaten during a car ride when 13 strangers carried her into a car at Yungang West Rd in Fengtai district (Beijing) (coded as Beijing - Fengtai). Her hands had swelled up from being cuffed behind her back for several days at the time of reporting of 8 Mar 2021. The incident was reported as one of multiple stability maintenance efforts carried out against petitioners nationwide during the annual Lianghui conventions.

On 6 March 2021, a petitioner from Wanshougonggong village of Dongxihu district (Wuhan, Hubei) and her husband were intercepted on her train ride to Beijing and forced by a group of people (identity unreported) to get off at Shijiazhuang Train Station in Qiaoxi district (Shijiazhuang, Hebei), where they were forcibly returned to a 'black jail' arrangement at Xinhua Hospital in Wuhan. Earlier during the train ride, eight men in casual wear had approached the petitioner and her husband to persuade them out of visiting Beijing during the Lianghui conventions, and men hired by the CPC Secretary of Cihui Subdistrict called from Xinhua Hospital to inquire about their location. Leading up the incident, the petitioner had been receiving treatment at Xinhua for high blood pressure and cerebral hemorrhage since 5 Jan 2021, during which government-hired men appeared and started guarding her ward around the clock, restricting her personal freedom. The petitioner was still held at the hospital as of 15 Mar 2021.

On 6 March 2021, a petitioner was captured from his residence in Beijing municipality by local authorities because he registered at the National Public Complaints and Proposals Administration the day before, then driven to the Beidahuang Group of State Farms and Land Reclamation in Heihe and Qiqihar prefectures (Heilongjiang). He was a past victim of illegal detentions, and his situation remained unknown at the time of reporting on 8 Mar 2021. The incident was reported as one of multiple stability maintenance efforts carried out against petitioners nationwide during the annual Lianghui conventions.

On 6 March 2021, a female rights defender was sexually harassed by drunk officials at the Taohua Police Station in Changshou district (Chongqing), and bruised her back and arms while resisting. The incident was reported as one of multiple stability maintenance efforts carried out against petitioners nationwide during the annual Lianghui conventions. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

Around 7 March 2021 (between 4 - 11 March), a petitioner was taken on 'mandatory vacation' from Qianjiang prefecture (Hubei) (coded to Yuanlin), and detained at a farmland hostel in Yichang prefecture until the end of the Lianghui annual sessions.

On 7 March 2021, a civilian from Dongxihu district, Wuhan was kidnapped by an unidentified group at the Shijiazhuang Railway Station in Qiaoxi district (Shijiazhuang, Hebei) while on his way to a reported medical visit to Beijing. The victim had been repeatedly targeted by local authorities in the past, and remained uncontactable at the time of reporting on 10 March. This was reported as one of multiple stability maintenance efforts carried out against petitioners nationwide during the annual Lianghui conventions.

On 8 March 2021, on the first day of the annual Lianghui conventions, a female petitioner living in Changning district (Shanghai) was invaded at their residence by an unreported party during her sleep, who attacked her with a knife and left her with a gash around her neck. She was similarly attacked three days ago. Leading up to the incident, she had been in discussion with the Huayang Rd Sub-district's newly appointed Head of Petitions, who promised to resolve all her petitioning efforts and stability maintenance incidents locally. At the time of the attack, she already agreed - in good faith - to cancel her visit to the People's Supreme Court in Beijing, where she planned to report unlawful procedures and forgery of documents by local officials during a house expropriation case in 2016.

On 8 March 2021, a female petitioner from Maping town of Guangshui, Suizhou was forced to ingest a hamburger laden with medicine at the Wuchang District Public Security Sub-Bureau's Shuanghu Police Station (Wuhan, Hubei), after she dialed the police for help from the Guangshui government-hired individuals camping outside her house and following her around. She was hospitalised after suffering from severe physical symptoms when she was returned home.

On 8 March 2021, a female petitioner-cum-forced evictee from Xiaoshan district (Hangzhou, Zhejiang) was intercepted by officers in a queue outside the State Bureau for Letters and Calls in Xicheng district (Beijing) (coded as Beijing - Xicheng) and kidnapped onto a car where the officers broke her fingers. After being escorted back to her hometown, she was hospitalized until 11 March 2021 and placed under eight days of administrative detention. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 9 March 2021, the son of a petitioner from Wanshougonggong village of Dongxihu district was held in a 'black jail' at Room 904, Black 5 of Kangju II in Cihui subdistrict of Dongxihu district (Wuhan, Hubei) by hired men ('evil forces') working for the CPC Secretary of Cihui Subdistrict of Dongxihu district. Both of his parents had been forcibly held at Xinhua Hospital since 6 Mar to prevent them from petitioning in Beijing during the Lianghui conventions. The son was still detained at the time of reporting on 16 Mar 2021.

On 9 March 2021, a war veteran was kidnapped by the Weibin District Government of Baoji, Shaanxi and more than 20 public security officers while visiting the Ministry of Public Security in Dongcheng District (Beijing) (coded as Beijing - Dongcheng). He was forcibly brought back to his hometown and secretly detained at an alleged 'black jail', remaining uncontactable at the time of reporting on 23 Mar 2021.

On 9 March 2021, a rights defender-cum-forced evictee was hospitalised in grave condition after being forced to take sleeping pills during her enforced disappearance at Nanyuan village, Fengtai district (Beijing) (coded as Beijing - Fengtai). The victim went into hiding on 26 Feb after anticipating being 'taken on mandatory vacation,' but was located by stability maintenance officers two days later and 'disappeared.' The incident was reported as one of multiple stability maintenance efforts carried out against petitioners nationwide during the annual Lianghui conventions. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 11 March 2021, a female petitioner was attacked in her sleep while being held under soft arrest ('black jail') at a room in Tingfeng Hotel in Changning district (Shanghai), sustaining a knife cut to her right arm. Earlier that day, she was intercepted at the Shanghai Pudong Airport - other petitioners were able to board their flight - under the orders of the Changning District Government, then escorted to her soft arrest location by officers from the Huayang Rd Police Station. They confiscated her belongings, identification and travel documents, and petition materials.

Around 15 March 2021 (month of), a petitioner was intercepted in Beijing and escorted back to his hometown in Qianjiang city, Hubei, where government-backed interceptors detained him for over 50 days. He was subjected to torture, forced prolonged positioning, and food deprivation during detention, resulting in rib fractures and other diseases. The authorities also demolished his house while he was in detention.

On 18 March 2021, a veteran was punched in his chest and kicked by the office director at the Petition Office in Shatou Township (Wenzhou, Zhejiang) while submitting a petition. He was hospitalized for bone fractures and soft tissue injury on his chest. He had been petitioning to reclaim his Certificate of the Right to Contracted Management of Rural Land for two years.

On 19 March 2021, as many as 70 petitioners, rights activists and citizens were rounded up into police cars at (and on their way to) the Shanghai No.1 Intermediate People's Court in Changning district (coded as Shanghai-Changning), and held at the Shanghai Stability Maintenance Center 'black jail' on 500 Fucun Rd in Putuo district. They were prevented from attending the public trial of a well-known female farmer and land rights activist, who was charged with 'inciting subversion of state power.' At least one of them was transferred to a detention centre in the evening.

On 22 March 2021, a Tibetan political activist was taken away by the police in Ganzi prefecture (Sichuan) (coded to Kangding City) for unknown reasons. His whereabouts were still unknown at the time of reporting on 15 April 2021.

On 23 March 2021, a Tibetan writer and former political prisoner was arrested by the police in Seda county (Ganzi, Sichuan) for unknown reasons. His whereabouts were still unknown at the time of reporting on 15 April 2021.

On 25 March 2021, at night time, a rights activist residing in Pidu district (Chengdu, Sichuan) with his mother was kidnapped by a group of unidentified individuals (assumed to be linked to the government). Political dissidents acquainted with the victim alleged that the act was a form of retaliation by the Chengdu police against him for openly commemorating lives of students lost during the 5.12 earthquake.

On 30 March 2021, a female rights defender was beaten to the ground by a public security officer (from Nanjie Police Station) while visiting a conservation and development company office in Fuzhou prefecture (Fujian) (coded to Gulou). She was visiting to inquire about the situation with her dilapidated house, but was targeted as the situation resulted from a forced demolition operation led by the Gulou District Urban Enforcement Department. She was punched again in the police car, and detained at the police station despite suffering from rib fractures and soft tissue damage. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: CPC: Communist Party of China; Police Forces of China (2012-)
NOTES: On 2 April 2021, a police officer-cum-CPC member under the Huang county (Anyang, Henan) Public Security Bureau tailed by three different cars (identified as 'dark evil forces') while driving in Zhengzhou prefecture (Henan) (coded to Zhongyuan), leading to his car being hit several times. It was purported that the aggressors intended to create a car accident to mask the murdering of the police officer. The officer had been subjected to smearing, isolation, attacks and retaliations since reporting corruption of state leadership to the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection in 2016.

On 2 April 2021, a Tibetan writer and environmental activist was taken away by the police in Seda county (Ganzi, Sichuan) for unknown reasons. His whereabouts were still unknown at the time of reporting on 15 April 2021.

On 2 April 2021, a female activist disappeared after completing mandatory coronavirus quarantine in Shenzhen city (Guangdong), and remained incommunicado at the time of reporting on 10 May 2021. Intending to visit her mother, she had told friends that she wouldn't stay in mainland China for long due to safety concerns, and planned to return during late April or May. They suspected that she was secretly detained for participating in the local pro-democracy movement since immigrating to Hong Kong. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 2 April 2021, a Tibetan female activist and former political prisoner was taken away by the police in Ganzi prefecture (Sichuan) (coded to Kangding City) for unknown reasons. Her whereabouts were still unknown at the time of reporting on 15 April 2021. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

Around 4 April 2021, a renowned rights activist from Jilin was sent to Jilin Guowen Hospital in Gongzhuling district (Siping, Jilin) with a brain hemorrhage while serving his 13-year jail term at Gongzhuling Prison. Upon hospitalisation, he was emaciated and unable to breath on his own. Surgeons removed 'a large piece of bone' from his artery that was blocking blood supply to his brain. He died on 9 April after having two operations and becoming comatose. It was reported that the victim was held in solitary confinement in a two-metre-square cell, and was subjected to prolong torture by authorities in order to get him to confess to charged offences. He was jailed after lodging an official complaint for embezzlement against several local officers but lost, and allegedly, for his public support for the pro-democracy movement in Hong Kong.

On 9 April 2021, at least eight people were rounded up and beaten by a dozen liaison and police officers from Wuxi prefecture while they were checked into a hotel in Langfang prefecture (Hebei) (coded to Guangyang), then taken into Jinghua Hotel in Fengtai district - the Wuxi Liaison Office in Beijing, reported to be a designated 'black jail' location for an unspecified duration. Some were reported to have been returned to Wuxi, then placed under arbitrary detention or house arrest. The incident was reported in relation to the intensified persecution of petitioners after the appointment of CPC Secretary of Wuxi Huang Qin.

On 11 April 2021, a Falun Gong believer was kidnapped from his home by a dozen police officers of Haizhu district of Guangzhou city (Guangdong), then taken to an alleged 'political brainwashing/re-education camp' at an unknown location. The victim was known for his legal profession, and had been persecuted - tortured, sent to labour camp - since 2007 for openly representing other Falun Gong believers and grassroots parties. He remained incommunicado at the time of reporting on 25 Apr 2021.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Falun Gong Group (China); Former Military Forces of China (2012-); Prisoners (China)
NOTES: Around 12 April 2021, a political prisoner, Former Deputy Chief of Staff of Shandong Provincial Reserve Artillery Division serving a seven-year sentence at Jinan Prison (Shandong) (coded to Lixia) for practising Falun Gong, was hospitalised due to sudden cerebral hemorrhage and passed away. The circumstances surrounding his death were reported to be suspicious due to the bruised and swollen state of his body remains. The victim and his family had been persecuted several times for his belief since 1999, such as being subjected to forced re-education and in-detention torture.

On 13 April 2021, the village party secretary leading a group of unknown people trespassed a disabled petitioner's land in Qianjiang city, Hubei (coded to Yuanlin), and kicked off a construction despite strong opposition from the petitioner. The petitioner tried to defend his land but was beaten up by the intruders for half an hour. He was arrested for picking quarrels and provoking troubles and prosecuted for intentional assault.

On 14 April 2021, a female rights defender was beaten with a baton by a staff during her visit to the Gulou District Housing Authority Bureau (Fuzhou, Fujian), by way of threatening her from submitting an application for the renovation of dilapidated houses. Her house was destroyed during a forced demolition operation led by the Gulou District Urban Enforcement Department. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 15 April 2021, a rights activist was kicked and choked at the Qiema Subdistrict Office in Beibei district (Chongqing) by the Vice Chief of the district's Sub-Bureau Security Bureau, then detained at the Qiema Police Station for nine hours. At the time, he had just been intercepted in Beijing with six other petitioners, and escorted back to Chongqing.

Around 15 April 2021 (as reported), a Falun Gong practitioner and lawyer was sent to 'political re-education' at the Changsha Prison in Changsha prefecture (Hunan) (coded to Yuelu) after demonstrating a 'wrongful attitude', referring to his refusal to accept charges brought forth during his secret trial. The re-education was reported as an additional component to the prison sentence being handed to him. He was not allowed lawyer or family visitations. The victim had been arrested since 28 Oct 2020 along with over 20 Falun Gong practitioners (many of them doctorates, academics and lawyers as well) were rounded up in Liuyang and Changsha prefectures for their belief.

On 20 April 2021, a man was hospitalised after being beaten up by a dozen lackeys of the Tongde Village Secretary at the Dafeng High-Speed Rail Station in Dafeng county (Yancheng, Jiangsu). His wife had been petitioning about being forcibly evicted from Tongde village in the past nine years, whom he was accompanying for a medical visit at the time of the beating.

On 21 April 2021, a lawyer was beaten up by some unidentified men while taking a stroll with his wife in a residential area near Donglinjicang, 302 Guangshanyi Lu, Tianhe district of Guangzhou city (Guangdong). The hospital diagnosed him with multiple bodily and facial injuries, bruises and fractures. National security officers were suspected to be involved in the incident by way of threatening him and his family to move out of Guangdong province, and back to his home province of Hunan. The lawyer had been a target of the state since 2018 for rights defending efforts, and representing tuberculosis patients in the suing of the Taojiang county government (in Hunan) for professional malpractice.

On 22 April 2021, a female petitioner was beaten in the head by a government staff at the Xinwu District Bureau for Letters and Calls (Wuxi, Jiangsu) for taking a photo of the staff member who received her petition registration. She was brought to a police station, then followed by police officers when she was eventually hospitalised.

On 24 April 2021, a resident was taken away by black-clad security officers during the second round of forced demolitions at Xiaotangshan village (Changping, Beijing), and couldn't be contacted at the time of reporting on 30 Apr 2021. Village government officials and police officers were present at the time. While many from the village were evicted, security officers had threatened to lock up this resident in particular in a wooden shed for a few days. The local police station confirmed that the resident was not placed in their custody. The victim might have been targeted as he was said to be still recovering from rib fractures caused by past eviction workers.

On 25 April 2021, four forced evictees from Xuetian village of Jingang town, Zhangjiagang were stopped by plainclothes officers at a crossing near Haihuisi station in Fengtai district (Beijing) (coded as Beijing - Fengtai), and at least one of them was slapped several times after they were taken into a police car (with a car plate issued by Jiangsu province). They were driven to Jinghua Hotel - which housed the liaison office of Zhangjiagang in Beijing - and escorted back to their hometown on the same day so that they were not able to file complaints about local government corruption. The injured evictee was admitted to a hospital for treatment.

Around 26 April 2021 (month of), a prisoner and rights defender from Bole, Xinjiang was reported to become 'gravely ill' while serving at the Halabula Prison in Xinyuan county (Ili, Xinjiang), losing the ability to speak and weighing only 30 kilograms. The news about his condition came on 26 April. Authorities refused his mother's request to inquiry about health condition.
