On 30 April 2021, a rights defender from Yubei district, Chongqing was released from Jiujingzhuang 'black jail' in Fengtai district (Beijing) (coded as Beijing - Fengtai), then intercepted at the 485 Rd Bus Stop nearby by five to six liaison officials and police officers from Longxing Police Station (of Chongqing). He was incommunicado for at least 24 hours. On 3 May, the victim communicated that he was on his way home, riding a coach bus with the escort of Longxing workers (assumed to be representing the police or local government).

On 7 May 2021, a petitioner and labour rights activist from Wulidun sub-district of Hanyang district, Wuhan was rounded up by five Hebei men after arriving at the Beijing Train Station, and told by a liaison officer that petitioners cannot visit Beijing 'while meetings were being conducted.' The liaison officer arranged for him to be escorted home by an officer from the Hanyang District Urban Management Bureau, yet instead, he was taken to a 'black jail' in the countryside of Luotian county (Huanggang, Hubei) that was located near a dog food processing facility. Along with six petitioners from Hanyang district, he was detained under the supervision of four former labour camp detainees. He escaped on 22 May 2021.

Around 8 May 2021, a detained suspect was hospitalised after suspected torture at the Bao'an Detention Centre in Bao'an district (Shenzhen, Guangdong). He was hospitalised on 8 May and passed away on 25 May. While receiving treatment in the intensive care unit, his family was denied visitation rights during all three times. They were not permitted to see his body despite four days after his passing, and on 27 May, two citizens (a rights advocate and a lawyer) were intercepted and taken in for police interrogation on the morning of their meeting at the Public Security Bureau Petitioning Office regarding the man's death. The suspect had been detained due to his brother's prostitution activity.

On 9 May 2021, in the early morning, two Protestant Christian churchgoers from Early Rain Covenant Church were assaulted at Damian Police Station in Longquanyi district (Chengdu, Sichuan) for inquiring about the detention of their catechist. They were kicked, slapped and scratched by several officers.

On 11 May 2021, a female reporter for Epoch Times - also head of the Hong Kong Association of Falun Dafa - was assaulted by an unidentified assailant near her Ho Man Tin residence in Kowloon City district (Hong Kong) (coded as Hong Kong - Kowloon City), who beat her for a minute with a baseball bat, then hopped onto a car and fled the scene with his accomplices. The reporter received hospital treatment for the multiple bruises to her legs. She had been followed by unknown individuals in the past year.

On 11 May 2021, a detained rights defender was beaten up at the Tiaodenghe Police Station in Chenghua district (Chengdu, Sichuan) after being rounded up at a demonstration at the local secondary school, where he was caught photographing the scene. He was also slapped in the police car on their way to the station.

On 12 May 2021, during the day, 600 men in black forcibly broke through the Fifth Door of Baoli Xiangxue Community in Shimahe sub-district of Jiangbei district (Chongqing), and assaulted residents indiscriminately. Caught off-guard, most of the victims were the elderly and children as young and middle-aged adults were at work. Some were dragged into vehicles and taken away. Riot police equipped with storm water cannons lined up outside the community prior to the mass attack, and at least one of the men in black was reported to have been hired as a part-timer by the Yubei district government. Since 2014, the residents of the Baoli Xiangxue Community and the Shimahe sub-district government were in disagreement about the construction of a community office.

On 13 May 2021, a female forced demolition victim was taken to the Hongmei Police Station in Tianning district (Changzhou, Jiangsu) by its chief officer, and remained incommunicado at the time of reporting on 13 Jun 2021. The victim's family suspected that she was held at 'black jail' location as she had been detained at 'black jails' five times before. The incident was reported as one of a series of 'stability maintenance incidents' to portray prosperity ahead of the 100th anniversary of the establishment of the ruling Communist Party.

On 14 May 2021, a rights defender residing in Kunshan county (Suzhou, Jiangsu) was abducted for planning an opening ceremony for her tea shop, which was deemed by local police authorities as illegal assembly due to the expected attendance of rights defenders from around the country. It was reported on 13 Jun 2021 that she was being held at a hotel 'black jail' under the custody of the Kunshan State Security Bureau.

Around 15 May 2021 (between 8 May - 22 May), a petitioner and labour rights activist from Wulidun sub-district of Hanyang district, Wuhan was beaten multiple times by his supervisors while detained at a 'black jail' in the countryside of Luotian county (Huanggang, Hubei) that was located near a dog food processing facility. His supervisors were four former labour camp detainees hired by the Hanyan district government. He escaped on 22 May 2021.

On 17 May 2021, a petitioner from Zhejiang was intercepted and beaten by more than 30 unidentified 'hooligans' as soon as he exited Beijing South Railway Station in Fengtai District (Beijing) (coded as Beijing - Fengtai). During the process, a petitioner from Heilongjiang tried to stop the beatings, but the group besieged him. It is suspected that the group was hired by government officials.

On 17 May 2021, two petitioners, who were a married couple, were intercepted by Loufeng Residential District police officers and government officials at Suzhou Railway Station in Gusu district (Suzhou, Jiangsu) while they were about to travel to Beijing to submit a petition. The interceptors pressed on their bodies and stripped their pants, resulting in one of them suffering from fractured bones.

On 18 May 2021, a former University of Guizhou professor was secretly taken away by the Guizhou Provincial Public Security Bureau (location coded to Guanshanhu) and went incommunicado. On 10 June 2021, it was announced that the professor was placed under Residential Surveillance at a Designated Location (RSDL) on the grounds of inciting subversion of state power. On 28 October 2021, he was officially arrested for an undisclosed reason and transferred to a detention facility in Wudang District, Guizhou.

On 20 May 2021, a petitioner from Jinniu district, Chengdu went missing after uploading a photo of at the Beijing South Station in Fengtai district (coded as Beijing - Fengtai), and phone-calling his friends for help. He was still unreachable at the time of reporting on 23 May 2021, and both the police and Sichuan liaison office in Beijing denied knowledge of his status or location. The Chengdu government was alleged to be involved in intercepting and controlling the petitioner at an undisclosed location.

On 20 May 2021, a hundred police officers from Cangzhou, Hejian and Shaheqiao arrested 20 clergical members and students at a factory-turned-seminary of the Apostolica Praefectura Sinsiangensis in Shaheqiao town of Hejian county (Cangzhou, Hebei). An arrested bishop and 10 priests were isolated at a hotel, and made to participate in a 'political brainwash convention' starting from 23 May. They were taught CPC guidelines on religious freedom.

On 20 May 2021, crowds were assaulted during a visit to the Shaanxi Province Public Security Bureau in Weiyang district (Xi'an, Shaanxi). They intended to deliver pennants and plaques to a police officer who exposed the living situation of an extreme poverty household in Lantian county, drawing attention and assistance from government authorities. They had been warned against visiting, and an ambulance was seen parked at the scene ahead of the beatings. They were beaten up by hundreds of police officers, and their gifts were snatched away. Many people were detained.

On 22 May 2021, police and officials intercepted a couple from Fan village in Beijing municipality during their long-lasting petition journey in the capital. Police transferred and detained the couple in hostels and sightseeing areas in Fan village of Hein county, Shanxi, where the female petitioner was hit and injured by the police. As reported on 21 August 2021, the couple had been detained for almost 90 days. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 23 May 2021, the pastor of the Huoshi Church in Guiyang prefecture (Guizhou) was interrogated at the Zhongshan E Rd Police Station in Yunyan district (Guiyang, Guizhou) and beaten by the District's Secretary of the Political and Legal Committee. Authorities had been attempting to convince him to cancel his 24 May flight to visit his Christian friends in Qinghai province. The pastor was hospitalised for injuries and tinnitus.

On 26 May 2021, a forced evictee from Jiang'an district, Wuhan was rounded up and beaten by employees of a property developer while defending her rights at a residential property within Wuhan prefecture (Hubei). Officers from the Zhuyeshan Police Station had her sent to a hospital, but refused to further investigate the incident.

On 27 May 2021, a farmer placed under long-term residential surveillance - since his release from labour camp in 2019 - was beaten up by an auxilary police officer under the orders of Caijiagang Sub-District officials (location coded to Beibei district, Chongqing). The incident was reported as one of a series of 'stability maintenance incidents' to portray prosperity ahead of the 100th anniversary of the establishment of the ruling Communist Party.

On 28 May 2021, seven female rights defending petitioners went missing after they last communicated that over 20 interceptors from Inner Mongolia province had surrounded their apartment on Fenghai South St in Fengtai district (Beijing). They continued to be not contactable four days later on 1 Jun 2021. The incident was reported as one of a series of 'stability maintenance incidents' to portray prosperity ahead of the 100th anniversary of the establishment of the ruling Communist Party. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 29 May 2021, a rights defender from Heilongjiang province was 'taken on mandatory vacation' from Beijing municipality. Liaison officers picked her up at a train station, and indicated that she would regain her freedom on 15 Jul 2021. While detained, she saw that she was first on a list of 3401 top grade ('A-level') to be 'stability maintained' by public security authorities this year. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 29 May 2021, a rights defender from Wushun, Liaoning was kidnapped onto a car with no license plate near the Xingcheng Meilianmei Supermarket in Yancun town of Fangshan district (Beijing), and transported to a soft detention arrangement at Xinfu No.3 Hospital in Fushun prefecture (Liaoning). Many 'black security guards' stood by in the corridor.

On 31 May 2021, a villager from Luzhuang village of Ningjin county (Dezhou, Shandong) was taken from his home by high-level government officials from Zhangguan township, and forcibly admitted for 'treatment' at the psychiatric ward of Dezhou No.2 People's Hospital. Previously, he had witnessed election fraud during the Luzhuang village committee elections on 8 May, and was stopped for recording the scene. His parents were ordered to cut contact with the outside world and refuse visitors, being effectively placed under house arrest.

On 31 May 2021, a female rights defender residing in Binjiang district was kidnapped by a district officer in Xiaoshan district (Hangzhou, Zhejiang) after she was deceived into riding on his car. She was held captive at an elderly home until 2 July 2021. The incident was reported as one of a series of 'stability maintenance incidents' to portray prosperity ahead of the 100th anniversary of the establishment of the ruling Communist Party. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 31 May 2021, a female petitioner-cum-forced evictee from Xiaoshan district (Hangzhou, Zhejiang) was held captive and attacked by government officers at a service station in Yixing city, Jiangsu, leaving her being severely injured and sent to Shaw Hospital for surgery. Government officers first intercepted her in Fengtai district, Beijing, on 29 May 2021 and escorted her back to her hometown. The incident was reported as one of a series of 'stability maintenance incidents' to portray prosperity ahead of the 100th anniversary of the establishment of the ruling Communist Party. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 1 June 2021, a farmer placed under long-term residential surveillance - since his release from labour camp in 2019 - was beaten up by one of the guards deployed by the Caijiagang Sub-District Government (location coded to Beibei district, Chongqing). The guard pressed against him, and stoned him. The incident was reported as one of a series of 'stability maintenance incidents' to portray prosperity ahead of the 100th anniversary of the establishment of the ruling Communist Party.

On 2 June 2021, a petitioner was rounded up and beaten by three to four stability maintenance officers in the hallway in front of his house in Dadukou district (Chongqing). When his friend (also a petitioner) came by to visit and decided to record the scene, the men snatched his phone. After the two petitioners reported the incident, all parties were taken in to Yuejincun Police Station, and an officer requested for the recorded video to be deleted from the petitioner's phone.

On 2 June 2021, a petitioner from Chongqing was beaten by local 'black forces' while visiting Beijing municipality to reflect his demands. The incident was reported as one of a series of 'stability maintenance incidents' to portray prosperity ahead of the 100th anniversary of the establishment of the ruling Communist Party.

On 2 June 2021, a citizen was forced to sit in a torture chair at the Yuejincun Police Station in Dadukou district (Chongqing) during a four-hour interrogation. He had been taken in on the same day for filming a petitioner being beaten up by unidentified persons related to the police.

On 3 June 2021, local authorities captured and detained a rights defender at a hotel 'black jail' in Panjin prefecture (Liaoning) (coded to Xinglongtai). The incident was reported as one of a series of 'stability maintenance incidents' ahead of the 100th anniversary of the establishment of the ruling Communist Party.

Around 4 June 2021 (week of), a petitioner was kidnapped into a car by security forces hired by the Sanlin town government (Pudong, Shanghai). He remained incommunicado in an unknown situation for eight days by the time of reporting on 12 Jun 2021. The incident was reported as one of a series of 'stability maintenance incidents' to portray prosperity ahead of the 100th anniversary of the establishment of the ruling Communist Party.

On 4 June 2021, an elderly petitioner from Xin, Changshou district, Chongqing was severely assaulted by three liaison officers in Beijing municipality. The incident was reported as one of a series of 'stability maintenance incidents' ahead of the 100th anniversary of the establishment of the ruling Communist Party.

On 5 June 2021, a female petitioner detained at Chengxi Police Station of the Fengdu County Public Security Bureau was transferred to a 'black jail' set up by the Xinjian Village Committee of Sanhe Subdistrict. Triad members guarded the facility. Before being detained, she had been beaten unconscious by unknown persons. The incident was reported as one of a series of 'stability maintenance incidents' ahead of the 100th anniversary of the establishment of the ruling Communist Party.

Around 5 June 2021 (week of), a female petitioner was beaten and dragged away by unidentified persons as she boarded a vehicle for Fengdu district (Chongqing). The police was called to the scene, and they took her away while she was unconscious. She was detained at Chengxi Police Station of the Fengdu County Public Security Bureau until 5 June. The incident was reported as one of a series of 'stability maintenance incidents' ahead of the 100th anniversary of the establishment of the ruling Communist Party.

On 5 June 2021, students were rounded up into buses by the riot police at the Jiangsu Province Education Department in Gulou district (Nanjing, Jiangsu), and reportedly went missing incommunicado. They were petitioning against a Ministry of Education directive to absorb several independent colleges - which were privately funded and 'more prestigious' - into vocational schools, for fear that the merger would involve the degrading of their degree qualifications.

Around 6 June 2021 (between 4 June - 8 June), four out of at least seven rights defending citizens from Chongqing had become incommunicado after conveying forced demolition issues in Beijing municipality, and 'being retaliated against by their local government.' The incident was reported as one of a series of 'stability maintenance incidents' ahead of the 100th anniversary of the establishment of the ruling Communist Party.

Around 6 June 2021 (as reported), a rights defender was tortured while serving his sentence at No.3 Detention Centre in Zhengzhou prefecture (Henan) (coded to Zhongyuan). It was reportedly an act of retaliation by the detention officers, after his family members filed a complaint against how late a gift of theirs was delivered to the rights defender.

On 8 June 2021, an arrested man was placed under residential surveillance in a designated location in a hostel in Panshan county (Panjin, Liaoning) for suspicion of coercive business transactions. He was denied visits by his lawyer, as reported on 24 August 2021.

On 8 June 2021, a female human rights defender from Yuzhong district, Chongqing was intercepted by petition interceptors in the Beijing municipality. She was sent to a 'black jail' in Chongqing where she was held until her release on 5 July 2021. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 10 June 2021, a rights defender from Dandong, Liaoning was held at a coronavirus quarantine facility in Yuanbao district after he was kidnapped from his rental accommodation in Beijing municipality by six officials from the Dandong Government, and the Public Security and Petitioning Bureaus. They disabled his cell phone and deactivated his social media accounts. He was moved to a detention facility on 26 Jun 2021 despite testing negative. The incident was reported as one of a series of 'stability maintenance incidents' to portray prosperity ahead of the 100th anniversary of the establishment of the ruling Communist Party.

On 10 June 2021, a petitioner from Liaoning province was taken away from his accommodation in Qianyan village of Yancun town (Fangshan, Beijing) by six personnel from the Public Security Bureau of Yuanbao District and District Letters and Calls Bureau in Dandong City. He was escorted to Dandong by 11 Jun and monitored 24 hours a day by two policemen, two middle-level officials in an isolation room. The guards refused to transfer him to a proper detention facility. The incident was reported as one of a series of 'stability maintenance incidents' to portray prosperity ahead of the 100th anniversary of the establishment of the ruling Communist Party.

On 10 June 2021, seven to eight individuals snatched the phone of a citizen of Changzhou, Jiangsu near the Xiangtun Bus Station in Xingshou town (Changping, Beijing), and forcibly put her into a car with a Jiangsu license plate. She was taken to Super 8 Hotel on Xihuan Rd, where there were government officials and policemen from Luoxi town, Xinbei district and Changzhou prefecture. On 11 June, she was transferred to Erjia Hotel in Changzhou by a car with a Beijing license plate. By the end of the day, she was transferred away and lost contact. The incident was reported as one of a series of 'stability maintenance incidents' to portray prosperity ahead of the 100th anniversary of the establishment of the ruling Communist Party.

On 10 June 2021, two petitioners were beaten and robbed at the Supreme People's Court in Dongcheng district (Beijing) (coded as Beijing - Dongcheng). One of them was beaten unconscious by three bailiffs, while the other was dragged and robbed by police officers stationed in Beijing and the deputy director of the Public Security Bureau of Tongjiang, Heilongjiang. One of them was then kidnapped and detained in a black jail in Shiyan prefecture, Hubei, while the other was transported back to Tongjiang, Heilongjiang and admitted to a small hospital in the city. The police sent two guards to the hospital and refused to allow hospital transferals.

On 10 June 2021, two rights defenders from Chongqing went missing in Beijing municipality, and remained incommunicado by the time of reporting on 13 Jun 2021. The incident was reported as one of a series of 'stability maintenance incidents' to portray prosperity ahead of the 100th anniversary of the establishment of the ruling Communist Party.

On 11 June 2021, an elderly female petitioner was forcibly admitted to the No.1 Chenzhou Hospital in Beihu district (Chenzhou, Hunan) by stability maintenance officers. The incident was reported as one of a series of 'stability maintenance incidents' to portray prosperity ahead of the 100th anniversary of the establishment of the ruling Communist Party.

On 11 June 2021, a villager in Wuxi prefecture (Jiangsu) (coded to Binhu) was pushed to the ground by a group of people, tied with cloth strips and carried away. Both her and her husband lost contact and their house had been completely destroyed. It was reported that legal houses in Wuxi had been illegally identified by the government as dangerous houses, leading to many cases of forced demolitions. The incident was reported as one of a series of 'stability maintenance incidents' to portray prosperity ahead of the 100th anniversary of the establishment of the ruling Communist Party.

On 12 June 2021, a lawyer from Beijing went missing incommunicado while visiting Siping prefecture (Jilin) (coded to Tiexi) to follow up on a investigation into the death of a rights defender, who had recently died in detention due to suspected torture. His accommodation looked disorganised as though his belongings had been rummaged through, and a voice call recorded on the phone of the rights defender's father indicated that the lawyer had called for help.

On 13 June 2021, a rights defender went missing after he was taken into the custody of the Hongkou District Government (Shanghai) and handed over to the subdistrict officials. He had remained incommunicado at the time of reporting on 18 June 2021. The incident was reported as one of a series of 'stability maintenance incidents' to portray prosperity ahead of the 100th anniversary of the establishment of the ruling Communist Party.

On 15 June 2021, an imprisoned rights defender was rounded up and assaulted by four prisoners at the Xi County Detention Centre (Xinyang, Henan) while writing up a complaint accusing against law enforcement officials. The assault was allegedly arranged by the authorities as well.

On 15 June 2021, officers from the Xinpaifang Police Station harassed and beat up an elderly woman in front of the Tiangongdian Police Station in Yubei district (Chongqing) under the orders of their station chief. The incident was reported as one of a series of 'stability maintenance incidents' to portray prosperity ahead of the 100th anniversary of the establishment of the ruling Communist Party.

On 15 June 2021, a patient - infected with AIDS due to contamination by a pharmaceutics manufacturer in 2004 - was 'forcibly placed under activity and access restrictions' at the Fifth People's Hospital of Suzhou in Canglang district, Suzhou prefecture (Jiangsu) (coded to Gusu). He was already admitted to a hospital ward at the time, but was suddenly placed under 24-hour monitoring by a dozen state security and police officers for unspecified reasons. They confiscated his phone and ID card, forbade him from leaving, and denied others from entering the ward. The victim had frequently encountered 'restrictions' during major political occasions so to stop him from petitioning about his AIDS infection accident.

On 15 June 2021, a political dissident living in Beijing municipality was 'taken on mandatory vacation.' The incident was reported as one of a series of 'stability maintenance incidents' to portray prosperity ahead of the 100th anniversary of the establishment of the ruling Communist Party.

On 16 June 2021, an elderly rights defender was beaten up by triad members at his rental accommodation in Beijing municipality while a police officer looked on without intervening. A few days ago, the rights defender had finished a court session in Chaoyang district regarding the abuse of power by the Changying Police Station.

On 16 June 2021, six villagers were beaten and injured during a forced demolition at Tanxi village (Fangchenggang, Guangxi) by around 100 law enforcement officers from the Urban Administrative and Law Enforcement Bureau led by the Fangcheng District Jiangshan Town Government, Tanxi Village Office, and a private company. They were beaten to the ground with kicks and punches, resulting in a woman in her sixties had to admit to hospital for brain concussion. Many other villagers were locked in their houses while the law enforcement officers destroyed around 100 acres of crops, trees, and reserved lands.

On 17 June 2021, a village secretary led his people to beat up two sons and two daughters-in-law of a female petitioner at the petitioner's house in Dongtan village (Qianjiang, Hubei). The petitioner had been a target of the village leaders for many years for her petitioning.

On 19 June 2021, a rights defending petitioner was kidnapped and assaulted by four unidentified men in their car when she stepped out of a police station at the train station in Chengdu prefecture (Sichuan) (coded to Wuhou). She was receiving assistance for being followed and restrained by those same men, who were trying to prevent her from boarding a train. Her trousers were taken off, as the men wanted to retrieve the cellphone she had hidden in her underwear. The men dropped her back at her home after knocking her unconscious. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Former Military Forces of China (2012-); Former Government of China (2012-)
NOTES: On 19 June 2021, a veteran and former deputy chief of the Urban Management Bureau in Wuxi prefecture (Jiangsu) (coded to Binhu) had lost contact. The incident was reported as one of a series of 'stability maintenance incidents' to portray prosperity ahead of the 100th anniversary of the establishment of the ruling Communist Party. He had been imprisoned twice for helping others in their rights defending efforts.

On 19 June 2021, two Christian worshippers were intercepted during a gospel mission in Wenzhou prefecture (Zhejiang) (coded to Lucheng) and transferred to a 'black jail' by officials from the United Front Work Department, State Security Department and Public Security Bureau of Hengyang prefecture, Hunan. For 20 days, they were detained and isolated at the Xihushanzhuang Resort in Hengyang.

On 20 June 2021, a political dissident living in Beijing municipality was 'taken on mandatory vacation.' The incident was reported as one of a series of 'stability maintenance incidents' to portray prosperity ahead of the 100th anniversary of the establishment of the ruling Communist Party.

On 21 June 2021, the wife of a rights defender was captured from her residence in Caoyuancun village, Xi county (Xinyang, Henan) by two police officers from Huaihe Police Station and some community secretaries from Caoyuancun for unreported reason. She was detained in a hotel for a day before being allowed to return to her place of residence under surveillance on the following day. [women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons]

On 21 June 2021, a petitioner with a clothing wholesale business in Haicheng, Liaoning was intercepted at the State Bureau of Letters and Calls in Xicheng district (Beijing) (coded as Beijing - Xicheng) by officers from the Beijing police and Haicheng Prefecture Public Security Bureau, then kidnapped and beaten up in a car. He was detained in Haicheng prefecture, remaining incommunicado as of 26 Jun 2021. The petitioner was in Beijing to report corruption involving one of his business clients and the Haicheng Xiliu Police Branch. The incident was reported as one of a series of 'stability maintenance incidents' to portray prosperity ahead of the 100th anniversary of the establishment of the ruling Communist Party.

Around 22 June 2021 (as reported), a detained female Uyghur human rights defender was tortured while in detention in Xinjiang Women's Prison (Xinjiang No. 2 Prison) in Kashi East Road Residential District of Xinshi district (Urumqi, Xinjiang). She was sentenced to life in prison in 2010 for 'splittism, leaking state secrets, and organizing an illegal demonstration.' On 22 June 2021, the authorities reduced her life sentence to 19 years and 8 months after she signed a written statement of remorse in 2017. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 22 June 2021, in the middle of the night, a petitioner from Heilongjiang was captured in Beijing municipality and taken to a hotel, where she remained incommunicado at the time of reporting on 26 Jun 2021. The incident was reported as one of a series of 'stability maintenance incidents' ahead of the 100th anniversary of the establishment of the ruling Communist Party.

On 22 June 2021, a petitioner from Baoshan district, Shanghai was intercepted at the State Bureau of Letters and Calls in Xicheng district (Beijing) (coded as Beijing - Xicheng) by liaison officers and escorted to Shanghai by train on 23 Jun, remaining incommunicado at the time of reporting on 26 Jun 2021. The incident was reported as one of a series of 'stability maintenance incidents' to portray prosperity ahead of the 100th anniversary of the establishment of the ruling Communist Party.

On 22 June 2021, three women were detained, under the watch of over 20 triad members, at a 'black jail' facility set up by the Xinjian Village Committee of Sanhe subdistrict, Fengdu district (Chongqing). The incident was reported as one of a series of 'stability maintenance incidents' ahead of the 100th anniversary of the establishment of the ruling Communist Party.
On 22 June 2021, a veteran from Shaanxi province was arrested in Beijing municipality and sent to Jiujingzhuang 'black jail'. He remained incommunicado at the time of reporting on 25 June 2021.

On 23 June 2021, an environmental activist was 'taken on mandatory vacation' by the State Security Department of his hometown in Jiangsu province (coded to Xuanwu), to an unspecified village near Tai Lake in the Changsanjiao area (the 'Yangtze Delta city cluster'). The incident was reported as one of a series of 'stability maintenance incidents' ahead of the 100th anniversary of the establishment of the ruling Communist Party.

Around 23 June 2021 (week of), a political dissident - and supporter of the 1989 pro-democracy movement - was 'taken on mandatory vacation' from Beijing municipality by state security officials from Guizhou. They brought him to Baiyangdian Resort in Hebei province.

On 23 June 2021, a petitioner from Wuxi, Jiangsu, who sought protection from police after submitting a petition, was taken away by personnel from the Beijing office of the Jiangsu Provincial Government in front of the National Public Complaints and Proposals Administration in Xicheng district (Beijing) (coded as Beijing - Xicheng). He was taken in a car to Jinghua Hotel in Xicheng district (Beijing) where he was placed under triad members' watch. During the 10-hour detention, he was knocked to the ground and lost consciousness and was suffering from food deprivation. He was transferred to Shuofang Police Station (Wuxi) on 24 June before being released on 25 June.

On 23 June 2021, the wife of a rights defender was captured from her residence in Caoyuancun village, Xi county (Xinyang, Henan) for the second time in a week by two police officers from Huaihe Police Station and detained in a local hotel for unreported reason. During her absence from home, stability maintenance officials destroyed security cameras in her house. [women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons]

Around 24 June 2021 (between 13 June - 4 July), a female petitioner was locked up and tortured at a 'black jail' in the mountain area in Jin'an district (Fuzhou, Fujian). She was abducted on 13 June 2021 for an unknown reason and was dumped in the mountain on 4 July 2021.

Around 24 June 2021 (between 24 - 25 June), ten family members of a petitioner were beaten and pushed by police officers outside Shuofang Police Station in Binhu district (Wuxi, Jiangsu) while petitioning for their family member who was beaten by police while petitioning in Beijing the day before. They were all arrested and detained for several days. One of the family members was admitted to the hospital for injuries.

On 26 June 2021, a female petitioner from Chongqing and her aunt were beaten up in a car in Jinshui district (Zhengzhou, Henan) by five to six interceptors from the Petitioning and Public Security Bureaus of Rongchang district, Chongqing. The interceptors were aiming to prevent the petitioner from taking her grievances to Beijing.

On 26 June 2021, a female rights defender from Wuhan was abducted by some people of unknown identity outside her apartment in Gangsi village, Fangshan district (Beijing) in a black car. Officials from Hubei Province Government Beijing Office and street subdistrict office were also present at the scene of the abduction. She was transferred to a room in Wuhan for a so-called 28-day 'coronavirus pandemic quarantine study class', where she was stripped naked, attacked in her genitals using electric batons, and placed under continual torture and ill-treatment. On 23 July 2021, she was finally sent back to her home in Wenjiawan Community after she deleted all of her photo records and social media content and signing a consent. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 28 June 2021, a female petitioner from Xiaogan, Hubei was intercepted by officials from her hometown while transiting at the bus station in Xiao village (Changping, Beijing). She was detained at the Hongbo Grand Hotel after they escorted her back to Xiaogan prefecture.

On 1 July 2021, two married rights defenders were escorted from a relief centre (for petitioners) on 200 or 500 Fucun Rd, Putuo district (Shanghai) to a 'black jail' near their home in Jing'an district. Another two were taken away from the same place to be placed under 'soft detention' in Xishan, Suzhou province (not house arrest). The 'disappearances' were enforced by the local government of Jing'an district. The four belonged to a group of nine Shanghai-based rights defenders brought to the relief centre after commemorating the passing of a pioneer in the rights defending movement. The five remaining defenders were picked up by officers from their local government and remained incommunicado as of 3 Jul 2021.

On 4 July 2021, over 10 triad members allegedly sent by the village leaders raided a civilian's house and attacked a petitioner in Xiajing village (Fuzhou, Fujian). Triad members threatened to take his life if he insisted on filing complaints about construction plans undertaken by the village mayor and secretary. He was left his teeth and ribs broken, however, the police refused to step into the case.

On 4 July 2021, a man from Xiyuan village, Fujian, was beaten up by government-backed triad members in a guesthouse in Emei village (Fuzhou, Fujian) as retaliation after he sought help from a policeman walking outside. An hour later, the policeman returned and set him free at Xindian Police station. Triad members first intercepted him at Beijing West station, Beijing, on 28 June 2021 and detained him at the house, where he was monitored, threatened, tortured, and attacked.

Around 10 July 2021 (as reported), police transferred a detained rights defender from the Qidao Police Station in Yuanbao district (Dandong, Liaoning) to a budget hotel nearby for two-day detention on 'security maintenance' grounds. The police first intercepted him at Siping, Jilin, on 6 July 2021, while he was on his way to visit his family members before forcibly transferring back to Dandong.

On 12 July 2021, staff members at the Wuchang District Old Town Reconstruction Project beat a homeless man in Wubei village, Wuchang District (Wuhan, Hubei), during an inspection of his ruined home following a forced demolition on 30 January 2021. Officers snatched his phone away, beat him to the ground, and hit him with a brick as the man intended to take photos of the demolition office team.

On 13 July 2021, local township government officers and police officers kidnapped a petitioner living at Shuanggou township (Xiangyang, Hubei) and detained him at a psychiatric hospital in Huangji township for one month and 18 days.

On 13 July 2021, a petitioner was dragged onto a car and beaten into his head, chest, and abdomen by stability maintenance officers while having a late night supper with friends in Chongqing municipality.

On 13 July 2021, a disqualified human rights lawyer was beaten up by police at Qingyang People's Court in Qingyang district (Chengdu, Sichuan) while filing a litigation case about losing his practicing license to provide legal services. Soon after he had used his phone to record himself, four police forced him to delete the video by pinning him down on the ground. He had his video deleted by the officers before leaving the court with injuries on two arms.

Around 15 July 2021 (month of), a Taiwanese prisoner was beaten up by a prison officer at the Wuyishan prison in Shangpu village (Wuyishan, Nanping, Fujian). He was sentenced to eight-year in prison for the crime of fraud.

On 16 July 2021, a female human rights defender from Yuzhong district, Chongqing was intercepted by petition interceptors in the Beijing municipality and sent to a 'black jail' in Beijing where she was detained until her release on 2 August 2021. Upon her release, she was repatriated to Chongqing but was forcibly taken to a hotel in Chongqing for COVID-19 quarantine. This followed another incident on 8 June where she was taken away by petition interceptors in Beijing. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

Around 16 July 2021 (month of), a female human rights defender, who was also a petitioner-cum-forced evictee, was taken away by the police in Shanghai municipality because she went to Beijing to submit petitions several times in the past six months. She was detained at a 'black jail' for 21 days. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

SOURCE: China Aid; Ming Pao; Radio Free Asia
NOTES: On 31 July 2021, a lawyer was arrested by the police in Panjin city, Liaoning province (coded as Dawa), and placed under residential surveillance in a hotel in Panjin city. He was arrested on suspicion of 'picking quarrels and provoking trouble' as he circulated a courtroom video posted online of a prosecutor admitting errors. He was transferred to a criminal detention facility on 29 August 2021 and released on 1 October 2021.

On 2 August 2021, a female lawyer was arrested by the police from her home in Beijing municipality and placed residential surveillance in a designated location after she circulated a courtroom video posted online of a prosecutor admitting errors. She was transferred to a criminal detention facility on 29 August 2021.

On 3 August 2021, stability maintenance officials hired by a village secretary beat up a disabled woman near a secondary school in Dafeng district (Yancheng, Jiangsu) to stop her from taking a coronavirus test. The officials threw her to the ground from her electric wheelchair, slapped her face, and caused her injuries. It was reported that the woman was harassed by the officials many times.

On 8 August 2021, a disabled vendor was hit in his head by urban management officers with a small chair at a market in Xinluo district (Longyan, Fujian) while he was selling goods. He suffered headaches and dizziness, causing him to stay at a hospital for 52 days. The vendor had been petitioning for oppression for over 20 years.

On 10 August 2021, a man was held incommunicado by two government officers and two police officers at a hostel at Huangsang National Nature Reserve in Suining county, Shaoyang. The abduction was to interrupt his participation in the funeral committee for a deceased democracy activist, Zhao Baozhu, who died on 10 August 2021 due to complications from liver cancer.

Around 13 August 2021 (as reported), a woman was assaulted from the back and kicked to the ground by police personnel at Tianfu Road Police Station in Wendeng District, Shandong, leaving her unconscious. It was reported that the woman was retaliated against during a dispute with the police after filing a complaint against a government department director.

On 15 August 2021, plain-clothed police attacked two Tibetans at a checkpoint in Yushu prefecture, Qinghai province (coded as Yushu city), during a stop-and-search of a group of Tibetan travelers for politically sensitive content carried on social media on mobile phones. Police pushed a Tibetan, who objected to being searched, into the Yangtse River, resulting in him being believed dead. Police then shot and wounded another Tibetan who attempted to intervene.

On 18 August 2021, a woman from Gaokeng town (Pingxiang city, Jiangxi Province) was abducted by local government officers at her home after submitting petitions at the Public Complaints and Proposals Administration. She was then held at the psychiatry department at Pingkuang General Hospital in Anyuan district, Jiangxi province, for so-called 'compulsory mental health treatment'. She was denied visits by her friends. After being forced to take pills in the hospital, she staged a hunger strike for four days. She was released on 25 August 2021. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 18 August 2021, a woman from Gaokeng town (Pingxiang city, Jiangxi Province) was abducted by local government officers at her home after submitting petitions at the Public Complaints and Proposals Administration. She was then held at the psychiatry department at Pingkuang General Hospital in Anyuan district, Jiangxi province, for so-called 'compulsory mental health treatment'. She was denied visits by her friends.

On 22 August 2021, a dozen police from Mengchaiwan police station and officials from the municipal religious affairs bureau raided the Early Rain Covenant Church in Chenghua district (Chengdu, Sichuan) and arrested 17 Christians and 10 children for suspicion of illegal gathering. During the arrest, police clashed with the church members and injured the meeting host's arm. Another two church members were kicked and beaten up by the police at the detention facility.

On 24 August 2021, subdistrict CCP and government officials leading over 100 police and officers forcibly took away an old woman and her daughter from their house at Huajin village, Gusu district (Suzhou, Jiangsu), and detained them at a local hostel. The officers then demolished their house, citing a compulsory demolition notice announced on the day.

On 26 August 2021, a doctoral student of the University of Hong Kong researching labor rights was arrested in Nanning city, Guangxi (coded to Qingxiu) and placed under residential surveillance in a designated location on suspicion of inciting subversion of state power. He was held incommunicado for at least five days.

Around 28 August 2021 (week of), a single mother was beaten up in Nanle county (Puyang, Henan) by 4-5 men ordered by the office director at the offices of the National Health Commission, as she tried to petition regarding the death of her 12-year-old daughter after having a coronavirus vaccine. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders][women targeted: girls]

On 30 August 2021, around four petitioners from Wuhan and Hubei, were kidnapped by government-hired thugs onto two black cars in front of Jianguomen Police Station in Dongcheng district (Beijing) (coded as Beijing - Dongcheng) after they reported the presence of Wuhan 'black jails' to the Beijing police. They have been held incommunicado since then. Their friend said that they were likely to be sent back to their hometown for illegal detention.

On 31 August 2021, a petitioner was assaulted by three plain-clothes police officers from the stability maintenance and terrorism division on his way to a market in Dayan village V, Dadukou district (Chongqing). He was forced to grab a butcher knife and use it to scare away the attackers successfully. Around 10 minutes later, a uniformed police officer arrived with the attackers, but he did not record the case.

On 31 August 2021, a petitioner detained at a psychiatric hospital for more than a month was transferred by the authority from Huangji township (Xiangyang, Hubei) to Anding Hospital in Xiangcheng district, where he was chained on a 'tiger chair' and forced to take psychiatric drugs.

On 2 September 2021, a petitioner was intercepted in Beijing municipality on his way to submit a petition. He was first transferred to a detention center in Pu county, Shanxi, and then a coronavirus quarantine facility in Xiangning country for detention on 11 September 2021.

SOURCE: Tibetan Review; Radio Free Asia; Voice of Tibet
NOTES: Around 5 September 2021 (between 25 August - 15 September), police had arrested at least 121 Tibetan monks and villagers in Wenbo township (also known as Dza Wonpo township), Shiqu County (Ganzi, Sichuan), for possessing pictures of the Dalai Lama, Tibet's exiled spiritual leader, and using the Tibetan language. Around 117 detainees were denied proper food, clothing, and medical care and subjected to physical torture, prolonged interrogation, and political re-education in custody. As reported on 2 October 2021, the authority had released all but three monks.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Prisoners (China); Uyghur Ethnic Group (China); Labour Group (China)
NOTES: Around 6 September 2021 (as reported), an Uyghur businessman and philanthropist was tortured and died in a government-run internment camp in Yining City (Ili, Xinjiang). After receiving his body on 6 September 2021, his family found out that both of his legs had already decomposed. Since being arrested in 2018 after donating money for constructing a mosque, the victim was tortured for confession of committing 'religious extremism' and kept in solitary confinement for a long time.

On 15 September 2021, a female petitioner-cum-forced-evictee was taken away by Fengdu county police and government officers near her residence at Liangjiang New Area in Yubei District, Chongqing, and remained incommunicado at the time of reporting on 17 September 2021. She had been a target of the state for many years for her petitioning.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Government of China (2012-); Police Forces of China (2012-)
NOTES: On 15 September 2021, on the International Day of Democracy, a man was tracked down to an internet bar by two black-clad men in Yuanjiagang community district of Yuzhong district (Yuzhong, Chongqing). The black-clad men slapped him, beat him up, and kicked him in order to stop him from attending a memorial event at Monument to the people's Liberation in the city center. It was suspected that four members of local government and police officials were behind the attack.

On 19 September 2021, a female independent journalist and an activist were taken away by police at a residence in Haizhu district, Guangzhou, ahead of the journalist's planned departure to study in the UK via Hong Kong. The pair was placed under residential surveillance in a designated location for 'incitement to subvert state power', mainly due to the regular gatherings of friends at the activist's home. On 5 November 2021, their family members received an arrest notice, stating that they had been officially arrested on 27 October 2021 and detained at Guangzhou No. 1 Detention Centre. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 20 September 2021, three petitioners from Qianjiang city, Hubei, including two women, were kidnapped by about 100 people, including a CCP officer of their village, onto a car outside the Heyi Police station in Fengtai District, Beijing (coded as Beijing - Fengtai), after they had attempted to escape from petition interceptors throughout the day. They were beaten up on the car journey before being dumped at Dongtan village, Qianjiang. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 21 September 2021, a petitioner was beaten up by Xinxu township CCP and government authorities at his residence in Jian city, Jiangxi (coded to Jizhou) for buying a train ticket to Beijing for submitting a petition. He was left having blood on his face.

On 24 September 2021, a female teacher from Zhangjia Yanxia village, Shandong, went missing and became incommunicado after sending the last message on the phone. She had been subjected to detention and interception since October 2018 due to her petitioning. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 24 September 2021, a female petitioner from Wuhan, Hubei, was intercepted by Wuhan stability maintenance officers and Beijing private security in Beijing. On the next day, she was escorted back to Wuhan and forcibly admitted to the psychiatric ward of Wuhan Hanyang Hospital. On 2 October 2021, the police arrested 10 of her supporters, attempting to rescue her from the hospital. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 26 September 2021, a petitioner from Panjin city, Liaoning, was abducted by interceptors at his residence in Beijing and escorted back to his hometown. Upon arriving at Panjin on the next day, he was detained at a hostel. The incident was allegedly related to heightened security measures ahead of Chinese National Day.

On 26 September 2021, a group of thugs led by the Chongqing police station director kidnaped a Chongqing petitioner onto a car outside the State Bureau for Letters and Calls in Xicheng district (Beijing) (coded as Beijing - Xicheng), causing injuries to the petitioner's shoulders. He was detained in Gaojiachang in Fengtai District, Beijing, before transferring back to Chongqing on 27 September 2021. The incident was allegedly related to heightened security measures ahead of Chinese National Day.

On 28 September 2021, a petitioner from Fushun city, Liaoning, was intercepted by petition interceptors and beaten up by plain-clothed court officers in Beijing, causing bleeding in his left eye and face. After seeking help from a friend, he had his phone confiscated and became incommunicado. The incident was allegedly related to heightened security measures ahead of Chinese National Day.

On 28 September 2021, four petitioners from Longxing township were intercepted by petition interceptors in Beijing and were sent to Jiujingzhuang 'black jail'. They were then transferred to a detention facility owned by Chongqing Municipal People's Government Beijing Office in Gaojiachang and remained incommunicado. The incident was allegedly related to heightened security measures ahead of Chinese National Day.

On 28 September 2021, nine petitioners from Chongqing were intercepted by petition interceptors in Beijing and sent to a detention facility owned by Chongqing Municipal People's Government Beijing Office in Gaojiachang. One of the petitioners was released on the next day and escorted back to Chongqing by railway. The incident was allegedly related to heightened security measures ahead of Chinese National Day.

On 28 September 2021, four petitioners from Chongqing were intercepted by petition interceptors in Beijing and sent to a Jiujingzhuang 'black jail'. The incident was allegedly related to heightened security measures ahead of Chinese National Day.

On 28 September 2021, a female petitioner from Qianjiang city was intercepted by petition interceptors at Beijing West Railway Station in Fengtai District, Beijing (coded as Beijing - Fengtai) and detained at Qi Lu Qing Hotel in Haidian District. On the next day, She was allowed to leave the hotel briefly to submit a petition in a bank under police surveillance. She was subjected to stability maintenance operation for three days in Beijing, and the incident was allegedly related to heightened security measures ahead of Chinese National Day.

On 30 September 2021, a group of government-backed people and two police officers attacked a family in Wu village (Anyang, Henan) on a house demolition operation, causing them injuries. The victims, including a disabled man, were then detained at the village offices while the authorities demolished their houses.

On 2 October 2021, a captured female human rights defender, who was also a petitioner-cum-forced evictee, was attacked by a government-hired security guard at Room 8603 of Hanting Hotel on Zhoujiazui Road, Hongkou district (Hongkou, Shanghai) after complaining about her extrajudicial detention. Her surveillant used knee-to-chest restraint to hold her down on the ground, causing her to suffer rib fractures. She was intercepted by police in Beijing on 29 September 2021 and repatriated to Shanghai by Shanghai Municipal People's Government Beijing Office officials and their people. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 8 October 2021, 'thugs' beat up a family at their house in Jianshe village of Rugao county-level city (Nantong, Jiangsu), forcing them to evict. An elderly resident, whom the 'thugs' hit, was rejected by the hospital for his head injury because of an 'order' by a CCP officer.

On 8 October 2021, a woman was verbally threatened or physically attacked by demolition office personnel in Xincun Residential District of Jiang'an district (Wuhan, Hubei). Officers locked her in a car for a few hours and beat her to the ground before releasing her. She had to be hospitalized for brain concussion.

On 12 October 2021, Suzhou police arrested 5 Christian agents of Abeka Academy - a Christian homeschool education program based in the US - in Suzhou city, Jiangsu (coded to Gusu). They had since been uncontactable for over 36 hours.

On 13 October 2021, officials raided a church school in Zhenjiang city, Jiangsu (coded to Runzhou), and arrested over 10 children, three teachers, and three parents to the police station. The children were released shortly afterward, but the parents and teachers remained uncontactable.

On 15 October 2021, a petitioner from Pingxing, Jiangxi was kidnapped by the Pingxing village police station director, Gaokeng township government officers and hired thugs in Nine Dragons Villas in Fengtai District, Beijing (coded as Beijing - Fengtai), during which he was violently beaten up and dragged onto a car. A few residents and private security officers attempting to stop the vehicle from leaving were also beaten up until their heads covered in blood.

On 16 October 2021, a disabled female petitioner from Changchun, Jilin, went missing and became incommunicado at Changchun Railway Station in Kuancheng district (Changchun, Jilin) at the night she was planning to travel to Beijing to petition at the Central Military Commission. Earlier the night, she was called by the police several times to instruct her not to go petitioning. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 18 October 2021, a woman was placed under residential surveillance in a designated location by police in Pinghai township (Putian, Fujian) on suspicion of supplying food for her ex-husband - a now-deceased murder suspect. Her arrest came after her ex-husband killed himself in a cave as authorities closed in to arrest him for allegedly murdering two people and injuring three others in a land dispute on 10 October 2021. The suicide of the murder suspect drew national attention and elicited an outpouring of sympathy for the accused. [women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons]

On 21 October 2021, a female forced eviction petitioner was beaten up by local government personnel from Xinjiekou Residential District at Xuanwu district (Nanjing, Jiangsu), causing her to suffer from neck injuries and fractured coccyx and breastbone. The incident was reported as a case of stability maintenance before the sixth plenary session of the 19th CPC Central Committee in Beijing. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 22 October 2021, a female rights defender-cum-forced evicted was beaten up by Xinjiekou Residential District officials at her residential area in Maqun Sub-district of Qixia district (Nanjing, Jiangsu) when she tried to stop them from monitoring her by taking videos. She suffered neck injuries and needed to be hospitalized. The incident was reported as a case of stability maintenance in relation to the sixth plenary session of the 19th CPC Central Committee set to commence in Beijing. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 22 October 2021, in the early hours, a dissident was taken away by police in Beijing municipality and forcibly admitted to a psychiatric hospital, where he became incommunicado. His wife had been told that he was taken away for picking quarrels and provoking trouble related to his internet speech. On 25 October 2021, police revealed that he was held at Tongzhou District Mental Hospital.

On 25 October 2021, a Catholic cleric was 'taken on mandatory vacation' by the authorities in Wenzhou city, Zhejiang (coded to Lucheng), ahead of an important period of the Catholic communities. He was arrested several times and often subjected to brainwashing to push him to join the CCP-controlled 'official' church.

On 28 October 2021, Jinyang Residential District police officers raided the home of a congregant of the now-shuttered Early Rain Covenant Church in Chengdu city, Sichuan (coded to Wuhou). Police officers pulled and beat two adults and a child, causing them to be hospitalized for injuries. Police then took three Christians to the Wuhou District police station.

On 30 October 2021, a female activist was taken away by local government officers in Beijing municipality and became incommunicado, as reported on 8 November 2021. Her disappearance came after her online activism urging for the immediate release of jailed citizen journalist Zhang Zhan, who was close to death during an intermittent hunger strike to protest her imprisonment for reporting news from Wuhan in the early days of the COVID-19 pandemic. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 2 November 2021, a high-ranked female tennis player Peng Shuai, who was a doubles champion at Wimbledon and the French Open, went missing and became incommunicado in Beijing municipality after she accused former vice-premier Zhang Gaoli of pressuring her into a sexual relationship in a social media post. It was the first time that the #MeToo movement had reached the highest echelons of the ruling CCP. The tennis players' disappearance raised international concerns about her personal safety and whereabouts.

On 3 November 2021, two petitioners on vacation were taken away by the police while their train stopped at Nanchang Railway Station in Xihu district (Jiangxi, Nanchang), and were sent back to Fuzhou. On the next day, they were detained at a hotel in Cangshan District, Fujian, for mandatory coronavirus quarantine for at least seven days. Their coronavirus tracking app status turned yellow despite not visiting an epidemic area, suggesting that the authorities had used the app to restrict people's movements for political purposes ahead to the sixth plenary session of the 19th CPC Central Committee set to commence in Beijing.

On 4 November 2021, a petitioner was beaten up and had his phone confiscated at Xuzhou Public Security Bureau Quanshan Branch Tai Shan Police station in Yunlong district (Xuzhou, Jiangsu). Earlier in the day, he requested a meeting with the bureau director at Xuzhou Public Security Bureau, but police took him away from the Bureau. Police released him after beating him.

On 5 November 2021, a rights defender from Dandong, Liaoning, was kidnapped from his rental accommodation in Beijing municipality by officials from the Dandong Government and sent back to his hometown. Upon arrival, he was held at a budget hotel under the surveillance of the police. The incident was a case of stability maintenance ahead of the sixth plenary session of the 19th CPC Central Committee set to commence in Beijing.

Around 5 November 2021 (week of), the husband of a recently arrested human rights activist was detained by national security officers in Gaoyou city (Yangzhou, Jiangsu) for punishing him for spreading the news about his wife's arrest to their relatives and lawyer. During the two-hour detention, he was held by the throat and thrown to the ground, causing injuries to his shoulders.

On 8 November 2021, a female petitioner was taken away by 5-6 unknown people in her neighbourhood in Jiangyan district (Taizhou, Jiangsu) ahead of a court hearing that she sued against the Hai'an environmental department. The petitioner, her husband, and two older adults of her family had become incommunicado as reported on 9 November 2021, resulting in the court hearing being cancelled. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

Around 8 November 2021 (as reported), a female activist from Shangqiu city, Henan (coded to Suiyang), went missing. Her appearance came after her online activism, urging for the immediate release of jailed citizen journalist Zhang Zhan, who was close to death during an intermittent hunger strike to protest her imprisonment for reporting news from Wuhan in the early days of the COVID-19 pandemic. It was suspected that she was taken away by the police. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]
Around 8 November 2021 (as reported), a dissident living in Beijing municipality was incommunicado as the sixth plenary session of the 19th CPC Central Committee kicked off in Beijing.

On 14 November 2021, a captured female human rights defender, who was also a petitioner-cum-forced evictee, was attacked by a government-hired security guard at Room 8313 of Shanghai Pattaya Holiday Inn in Yangpu district (Yangpu, Shanghai) after concerns over her health and hygiene. She was slapped in the face and nipped on her wrist. She was intercepted by police in Beijing on 29 September 2021 and finally released on 18 November 2021 after detaining in two Shanghai hotels. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders][women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

Around 18 November 2021 (week of), a petitioner from Hongkou district was detained at Room 8603 of Hanting Hotel on Zhoujiazui Road, Hongkou district (Hongkou, Shanghai) by a government-hired security guard for an unreported reason.

On 21 November 2021, a female petitioner was intercepted by Zhangjiabao Sub-district Office officers at Xi'an Railway Station in Xincheng district (Xian, Shaanxi) as she was traveling to Beijing to submit a petition. A few 'thugs' snatched away her personal belongings and pushed her to the ground, causing her to fall unconscious. She later woke up inside a car in Yandong Unit but was forbidden to seek help from police and medics until she was dumped out of the vehicle on Wenjing road after midnight.

On 23 November 2021, a lawyer became uncontactable upon arriving at a railway station in Shanghai municipality. Early in the day, he revealed on social media that he would meet the US Consul General in Shanghai concerning jailed citizen journalist Zhang Zhan, who was close to death during an intermittent hunger strike in prison. The lawyer had been prevented from traveling to Shanghai by the police to visit the jailed journalist's mother early in the month.

On 24 November 2021, four petitioner-cum-forced-evictees were intercepted and beat up by Suzhou Gusu Public Complaints and Proposals Administration officers and police upon arriving at Nanjing railway station in Xuanwu district (Nanjing, Jiangsu) when they were on their way to submit petition documents to Nanjing High People's Court. An old petitioner was therefore suffered from tension headache and coma and needed to admit to a hospital. The three others were repatriated to Suzhou city, where an injured female petitioner was detained immediately at a police station in Gusu district.

On 25 November 2021, a female petitioner and her fellow villager were taken away by police when they passed by the France Embassy in Chaoyang district, Beijing (coded as Beijing - Chaoyang) without a known reason. They were tortured, humiliated, and had their pants forcibly taken off for searching on a car journey before being repatriated to Fuzhou. The next day, the petitioner was detained at a Jin'an government-run 'black jail' in Fuzhou and had remained incommunicado at the time of reporting on 10 December 2021.

On 30 November 2021, an elected female village leader from Yangzhai village (Suzhou, Anhui) was intercepted by petition interceptors in Beijing municipality after submitting evidence of illegal and criminal activities against a village secretary to the National Public Complaints and Proposals Administration. She went incommunicado after being repatriated to her hometown, as reported on 2 December 2021. [women targeted: government officials]

On 5 December 2021, a human rights activist from Tianhe district (Guangzhou, Guangdong) went missing for the second time this year after sending a message signaling his arrest. He became incommunicado at the time of reporting on 7 December 2021. On 28 January 2021, he was intercepted by police at Shanghai airport and became uncontactable as the authorities prevented him from leaving China to visit his sick wife in the US.
On 17 October 2019, a KMT: Kuomintang Taoyuan City Council member was attacked at her own office in the Zhongli District, Taoyuan City.

On 9 August 2021, 5 men broke into the local anti-wind turbine group president's home and beat him and his family members in Sihu Township of Yunlin County. The victim suspects he was targeted for opposing the installation of 26 wind turbines in the community.

On January 1, 2019, a man deliberately plowed a car into crowds celebrating New Years Day in Shibuya, Tokyo, injuring nine people. The police, who caught the men shortly after, found 20 liters of kerosene in his vehicle. The men initially declared that he wanted to set fire to people gathered at Meiji Shrine because he wanted to commit an act of terror in retaliation for the death penalty system which is active in Japan. He also referred to the execution of Aum Shinrikyo cult members, although the connection between him and the cult remains unknown.

Around 1 June 2018 (beginning of month), 2 soldiers raided a house of an executive of a collective farm in Ryanggang Province (coded at Hyesan City). They beat the farmer with a club and stole some bags of rice. It is believed that the incident occurred due to food shortages in military units caused by the previous year severe drought.

On 13 July 2018, three robbers, assumably soldiers, broke into a house in Wiyeon-dong, a suburb of Hyesan City, threatening a 60-year-old man with a knife. Two residents who witnessed the incident shouted and were stabbed by the robbers. The burglars stole household items. It is believed that the incident occurred due to food shortages in military units which led the soldiers to steal.

Around 25 October 2018 (between October 20 - 31), the head communications officer of the elite Supreme Guard Command, the personal bodyguard force for Kim Jong Un, was purged after he was reportedly caught listening to Radio Free Asia while on patrol in Pyongyang. Other officers in the division also went missing during the investigation, according to anonymous sources inside North Korea.

Around 1 March 2019 (as reported), five senior foreign ministry officials, including the special envoy to the United States, were executed at Mirim Airport (Pyongyang) following the collapse of the second U.S.-North Korea summit.

Around 1 April 2019 (beginning of month), 4 high-level foreign ministry officials, including an official from the North Korean embassy in Hanoi, were executed by firing squad in Pyongyang in early April, as reported by Asia Press from multiple sources inside North Korea. It was reported that these officials were executed as a result of the failure of the US-DPRK summit in Hanoi.

On 25 June 2019, an Australian citizen who was an international student at a Pyongyang university and a tour guide in Pyongyang disappeared from social media and from contact with his families and friends. Australia's prime minister first confirmed his disappearance on 2 July 2019. The Australian student was released by North Korea during the visit of Swedish special envoy to North Korea. He arrived in Tokyo and united with his wife on 4 July, 2019.

On 7 November 2019, 2 North Koreans who tried to defect from the country were handed to the North Korean authorities by the South Korean government. They were imprisoned at the detention center located in Sariwon. As reported by Daily NK from a source inside North Korea, the arrested defectors were subjected to harsh torture for about 50 days and then executed.

Around 15 July 2020 (month of), an anonymous source reported that the camp guard of Correctional Labor Camp Number 6 (Songgan County) raped a female prisoner and killed her. After the incident, the guard was publicly executed.

SOURCE: Apple Daily Hong Kong; Daily NK
NOTES: On 11 August 2020, North Korean Coastal Patrol opened fire on 10 Chinese fishing boats who were fishing illegally in North Korean waters near Haeju and Ongjin Counties off the coast of South Hwanghae Province. At least three Chinese fishermen were killed and the Chinese boats retreated. Chinese authorities did not confirm the incident, but did order a ban on fishing activities near Dandong, Liaoning which is across the border from Sinuiju, North Korea.

Around 15 February 2021 (as reported), the family members of seven people, a smuggler and border guards who were sent to a political prison camp on a charge of smuggling in Manpho City, were taken somewhere. This incident led to the stringent lockdown measures imposed on Chasong and Manpho.

Around 22 February 2021 (month of), the wife and two sons of a command post manager of North Korea's 3rd Corps who was executed by firing squad in Nampo, South Pyongan, were sent to a political prison camp, and the state confiscated both their house and property. The command post manager was executed for watching and storing Korean dramas and entertainment shows.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of North Korea (2011-) State Security Department
NOTES: Around 11 March 2021 (week of), the North Korean authorities (Ministry of State Security ) executed the chairman of the Distance Education Act commission for 'anti-party and anti-revolutionary sectarian activities within the education sector' after it was found during an investigation that the commission failed to achieve any progress or results. It is believed that the chairman criticized the activity of the commission (event coded at Pyongyang since the commission is active in the capital city and most likely the execution occurred here).

Around 15 March 2021 (month of), the North Korean Coastal Patrol fired warning shots with rubber bullets at a Chinese fishing boat that was fishing illegally in North Korean waters near Haeju off the coast of South Hwanghae Province (coded at Coast of Haeju). The boat tried to flee but it hit a submerged rock and sunk. 7 Chinese fishermen died and the North Korean authorities did not try to rescue them.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Former Military Forces of North Korea (2011-)
NOTES: On 28 March 2021, a former soldier from Unit 974, which is a unit that guards DPRK leader Kim Jong Un, sexually assaulted a female student and killed her in Myongchon county. As he guarded Kim Jong Un at close range, he has received special treatments by the county party committee even though he was discharged from the unit. It is unknown what sentence was handed down to him.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of North Korea (2011-) State Security Department
NOTES: Around 18 April 2021 (from 17 - 19 April), 23 street vendors were taken to the labor camps by the State Security Police in Hyesan City as a street clean-up operation by the authorities. According to the source, it is interpreted as the authorities' intention to highlight the willingness to control residents and strengthen internal crackdowns. The arrests seem to be triggered by orders received in early April to eliminate 'anti-socialist' behavior. It is unknown if these actions were legal or not.

On 27 April 2021, a female inmate died in a provincial detention cell (Hyetan, Hyesan City, Ryanggang) after a prison officer hit her head with his rifle because she allegedly not followed the detention cells rule. She was imprisoned in March 2020 for trying to defect from North Korea. As reported by Daily NK from a source inside North Korea, she was malnourished and prisoners in Yanggang Province detention facilities are often sexually and physically assaulted by the prison officers.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of North Korea (2011-) Ministry of People's Security
NOTES: Around 15 May 2021 (week of), the Ministry of People's Security took about 60 family members and relatives of a state security official scattered across the country to a political prison camp. According to the source, the state official was accused of keeping the land ownership documents inherited from the Japanese colonial era discovered during the state's land readjustment and conversion project (coded at Pyongyang).

ACTOR1: Police Forces of North Korea (2011-) State Security Department
NOTES: On 30 May 2021, a 37-year-old off-duty soldier was beaten to death by a group of state security police officers on the street market in Chongjin City. As reported by Daily NK from a source inside North Korea, the late soldier tried to protect the street vendors from a police raid.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of North Korea (2011-) Border Guard
NOTES: On 2 June 2021, a couple who attempted to defect was beaten by the border guards after being arrested near the Tumen River in Hoeryong City. While the woman was sent to a Ministry of State Security office in Hoeryeong for further investigation, her boyfriend was transported to the one in South Hamgyong province.

Around 15 June 2021 (month of), two soldiers (most likely stormtroopers) dispatched to install barriers and high-voltage wire fences on the border between North Korea and China killed two civilians in Hoeryong City. The soldiers killed them as the civilians caught them stealing food. It is believed that the incident occurred due to food shortages in military units, which led the soldiers to steal. The soldiers ran away and their whereabouts are unknown.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of North Korea (2011-) State Security Department
NOTES: On 17 July 2021, the Police State Security Department took a woman in her 20s and her family living in Hyesan City to a political prison camp for allegedly criticizing North Korea's ruling 'Kim Family.' As reported by Daily NK from a source inside North Korea, the woman made anti-regime comments during a quarrel with three soldiers, and the soldiers reported her to the state security.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of North Korea (2011-) State Security Department
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of North Korea (2011-); Prisoners (North Korea)
NOTES: On 18 July 2021, the North Korean authorities (Police State Security Department) executed the Commander (Rear Admiral) of the 8.15 Base for allegedly slandering the Special Order in which the state authority planned to supply military rationing to its people amid the country's shortage of food and necessities. It is believed that the commander criticized the special order as an order made 'without knowing the reality' (location unknown, but the event most likely occurred in Pyongyang).

On 10 September 2021, 3 soldiers robbed potatoes and attacked farmworkers in the potato field in Potae-ri, Samjiyon County. They broke a farmer's leg during two rounds of looting in three hours. As reported by Asia Press from a source inside North Korea, authorities demanded that the assailants be found and brought to justice.
Around 15 September 2021 (month of), a soldier from the 12th Corps dispatched to Kapsan County (Ryanggang) sexually assaulted a woman.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of North Korea (2011-) Ministry of People's Security
NOTES: Around 5 October 2021 (between 1 - 10 October), the Ministry of Social Security took about 30 street vendors in Hyesan City to forced labor brigades for selling goods on the street in 'contradiction to party orders.' North Korean authorities reportedly launched an intensive crackdown on street vendors, also known as grasshopper merchants, and arrested people who put up serious resistance.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of North Korea (2011-) Border Guard
NOTES: Around 30 October 2021 (week of), border security soldiers arrested a woman in her 20s in Hoeryong City who attempted to defect to China due to difficulties in living. Officials of the preliminary hearing security guards physically attacked and sexually assaulted the woman. At last, she killed herself on 30 October.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of North Korea (2011-) Border Guard
NOTES: On 18 November 2021, a man in his 40s who was returning from China to North Korea was arrested by border security soldiers at Kimhyongjik County and beaten by them during his arrest and investigation. The man testified that he had gone to China to receive money, but soldiers took the money and charged him for smuggling in violation of state quarantine policies. Until the Ministry of State Security conducts his preliminary hearing, he would be isolated for coronavirus quarantine for 30 days.

On 2 April 2020, 3 unidentified men attacked a supporter of Women's Party during an election campaign near Hongik University subway station exit 9, Mapo, Seoul. One of the men threw a stone to a female supporter of Women's Party, resulting in a minor injury. [women targeted: political party supporters]

SOURCE: Kukmin Ilbo; Hankook Ilbo; Chosun Ilbo; Munhwa Ilbo; Segye Ilbo
NOTES: On 8 April 2020, a man assaulted a Nation Revolutionary Dividends Party (NRDP) member during the election campaign at the Gupo Market in Buk, Busan. The man was arrested by police.

SOURCE: Chosun Ilbo; Hankook Ilbo; Munhwa Ilbo; Kukmin Ilbo; Segye Ilbo
NOTES: On 8 April 2020, a man assaulted a Justice Party member during the election campaign near Yeonam Park in Buk, Daegu. The man was arrested by police.

SOURCE: Hankook Ilbo; Kukmin Ilbo; Munhwa Ilbo; Chosun Ilbo; Segye Ilbo
NOTES: On 9 April 2020, an armed man with a knife attempted to attack a United Future Party candidate during the election campaign in Jayang-dong, Gwangjin, Seoul. The man was arrested by police. No injuries were reported.

On 12 April 2020, a man assaulted a parliamentary (independent) candidate and his supporters during the candidate's election campaign near Jinju Industrial Complex in Jinju, resulting in 5 injured. The man was arrested.

On 25 March 2018, during an internal election organized by the Democratic Party in Bayanzurkh District, Ulaanbaatar, one Democratic Party member intentionally hit an opponent with a car, who is also member of the Democratic Party. The two DP members were running against each other.

On 27 July 2018, a Turkish national, Director of ''Ulaanbaatar Empathy'' school was abducted by strangers with masks outside his home in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia and released about 9 hours later at the results of efforts of his school teachers and Mongolian government organisations including the police and Ministry of Foreign Affairs. He has been living in Mongolia for over 24 years. According to the reports, the director is affiliated with the Turkish Gulen movement in Mongolia.

Around 18 December 2018, a member of the Democratic Party of Bulgan province, who is also a member of the Citizens' Representative Meeting of Bugat soum, Bulgan province was killed in his home in Bulgan by six people including members of the Mongolian People's Party. Apparently, a political conflict existed between the provincial chapters of the two parties.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Government of Mongolia (2016-); MPP: Mongolian People's Party
NOTES: On 21 May 2021, a lawmaker who is the Minister for Education and Science (MPP member) was attacked with a knife by an unidentified armed individual inside the ministry building (Ulaanbaatar-Su'xbaatar) and had a minor injury. The attacker previously complained about the 'compulsory Chinese vaccination' for secondary school students aged 16-17. The ministry denied any plans to vaccinate students.
